citation.title: Milk fatty acids in Germany

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: This dataset contains the detailed fatty acid composition of German retail milk. Whole milk samples with 'best before' dates ranging from January to December 2006 were collected biweekly from supermarkets. On each sampling date, three brands from both organic and conventional production were included. In total, the dataset comprises 80 conventional and 77 organic samples, thus covering variation due to both season and production system. Consequently, the dataset accurately reflects the average fatty acid composition of milk in Germany. These data were collected as part of a project to authenticate organic milk, and they represent a full calendar year.

Dieser Datensatz enthaelt die detaillierte Fettsaeurezusammensetzung von Milch aus dem deutschen Einzelhandel. Alle zwei Wochen wurden Vollmilchproben mit Mindesthaltbarkeitsdaten von Januar bis Dezember 2006 aus Supermaerkten entnommen. An jedem Probenahmedatum wurden drei Marken aus oekologischer und konventioneller Produktion beruecksichtigt. Insgesamt umfasst der Datensatz 80 konventionelle und 77 oekologische Proben und deckt somit sowohl saisonale als auch produktionssystembedingte Schwankungen ab. Folglich spiegelt der Datensatz die durchschnittliche Fettsaeurezusammensetzung von Milch in Deutschland genau wider. Diese Daten wurden im Rahmen eines Projekts zur Authentifizierung von Bio-Milch erhoben und repraesentieren ein volles Kalenderjahr.

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: ALLena: Thaw depth measurements of the active layer in the Lena River Delta region from 1998 to 2022, Northeastern Siberia, detailed table 'Detailed_data_TD_Schwamborn'

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Active layer thickness (ALT) is one of currently two Essential Climate Variables related directly to permafrost regions as defined by the Global Climate Observing System (GCOS) at the World Meteorological Organization (WMO). ALT is determined as the maximum thaw depth at the end of the thawing season and is being monitored across the Arctic to better understand climate change impacts on landscape, permafrost, hydrology, vegetation, and soil biogeochemistry. In addition, spatially and/or temporally distributed measurements of thaw depth (TD) in the active layer during the thawing period are often recorded during field work in permafrost regions for various research purposes and process understanding. The ALLena dataset presents a compilation of thaw depth (TD) measurements of the active layer in the Lena River Delta region based on published and unpublished field data collected during Russian and joint German-Russian expeditions from 1998 to 2022. The dataset contains data from different areas of the Lena Delta region with clustering in research-intensive areas, e.g. in the vicinity of Research Station Samoylov Island, but also includes sites adjacent to the delta such as Muostakh Island, Bykovsky Peninsula and Tiksi settlement surroundings. The compiled data is distributed across various ecosystems and geomorphological units underlain by different types of deposits and characterized by various relief positions, microtopography, soil and vegetation cover (e.g. active floodplains, polygonal tundra on Holocene Lena Delta terraces, remnants of Yedoma Ice Complex, etc.). TD measurements were conducted as opportunistic single as well as targeted TD transects or grid measurements. For some sites measurements of TD were repeated at the same locations in different years. TD was measured one time per site or several times per site within a few centimeters to several meters to capture small-scale heterogeneity depending on e.g. microcrotopography or vegetation type. The main datatable (doi:10.1594/PANGAEA.973813) contains discrete TD values if they were measured one to three times per site. In case of more than three TD values per measurement site, the main datatable provides the minimum, maximum, and mean TD as well as the number of measurements that were averaged. For sites with more than three TD measurements per site, separate detailed tables like this one are provided. The dataset presents a highly valuable compilation of TD data over a uniquely large Arctic region and long time span. It might complement the Circumpolar Active Layer Monitoring (CALM) program and other published ALT and TD datasets for other permafrost regions and may be used for e.g. parametrization or validation of permafrost modelling and remote sensing studies.

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: Bundeslebensmittelschluessel (BLS), Version 4.0 - Deutsche Naehrstoffdatenbank

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Der Bundeslebensmittelschluessel (BLS) ist die nationale Naehrstoffdatenbank Deutschlands. Er dient als Standardinstrument fuer die Ernaehrungsforschung, insbesondere zur Auswertung von Verzehrsstudien, und bildet die Datenbasis fuer Ernaehrungsberatung sowie die Berechnung der Naehrwertkennzeichnung. Version 4.0 wurde grundlegend ueberarbeitet und enthaelt 7.140 Lebensmittel mit 138 Naehrstoffen. Neben aktuellen Produktgruppen wie Pflanzendrinks und Pseudogetreide wurde auch die Naehrstoffauswahl erweitert - darunter neue Vitaminformen, Ballaststofffraktionen und das Spurenelement Molybdaen. Ein zentrales Qualitaetsmerkmal ist die umfassende Datentransparenz: Jeder Naehrstoffwert ist mit seiner Herkunft dokumentiert und einer von insgesamt 13 Herkunftsarten (wie Laboranalyse, Rezeptberechnung oder Literaturwert) zugeordnet.

The Bundeslebensmittelschluessel (BLS) is Germany's national nutrient database. It serves as the standard tool for nutrition research, particularly for the evaluation of dietary surveys, and provides the data basis for dietary counselling and nutrition labelling calculations. Version 4.0 has been fundamentally revised and contains 7,140 foods with 138 nutrients. In addition to current product groups such as plant-based drinks and pseudocereals, the nutrient selection has also been expanded - including new vitamin forms, dietary fibre fractions and the trace element molybdenum. A key quality feature is the comprehensive data transparency: Each nutrient value is documented with its origin and assigned to one of 13 data source categories (such as laboratory analysis, recipe calculation or literature value).

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: Code: Entwicklung neuer Algorithmen fuer FoodCASE

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Die Erfassung von Naehrstoffdaten dient der Berechnung von verpflichtenden Naehrwertkennzeichnungen, sowie als Datengrundlage fuer ernaehrungs- und gesundheitspolitische Massnahmen. Dazu hat das Max-Rubner-Institut den Bundeslebensmittelschluessel (BLS) erarbeitet, welcher mit Hilfe von Laboranalysen und Literaturrecherchen erstellt wird. Die FoodCASE Software ermoeglicht verschiedene Funktionalitaeten aufbauend auf dem BLS. Durch neue Algorithmen und Maschinellem Lernen soll FoodCASE verbessert werden. Zum einen soll die Ermittlung von Prozentanteilen einzelner Naehrstoffe optimiert werden. Anderseits soll die Auffindung von Lebensmitteln in der Datenbank mithilfe von Large Language Models (LLMs) verbessert werden.

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: Correction - Spray drift ground sediment resulting from application with UASS equipped with rotary atomizers and air injection nozzles

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: This is a correction due to errors in the evaluation of the validity of the tests of the data set publication: Ahrens, K., Herbst, A., & Wegener, J. K. (2025). Spray drift ground sediment resulting from application with UASS equipped with rotary atomizers and air injection nozzles [Data set]. OpenAgrar Repository. https://doi.org/10.5073/20250728-165753-0. Entries in parameter 'validity' in table '1 tests' changed. The dataset contains spray drift data from pesticide application with UASS equipped with rotary atomizers and air injection nozzles. One table describes the tested variants, application parameters and average weather data. Other tables contain the drift sediment data for each variant and test replicate vs. the downwind distance, the deposition data in the spraying area and the wind conditions for each test replicate with a sample rate of 1/s.

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: Dataset: FIT for purpose? Sampling Bees in Flowering Canopies with Flight Interception Traps

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: The present dataset contains the complete list of bee individuals sampled for a study that investigated the feasibility of sampling bees in flowering tree canopies with window interception traps (WIT) and aerial Malaise traps (AMT), both equipped with a bottom collector (below the interception surface) and a top collector (above the interception surface). We sampled bees in flowering canopies of four tree taxa: willow (Salix), apple (Malus), black locust (Robinia), linden (Tilia). Sampling took place over five sampling rounds between 4 March and 10 June 2024. We sampled bees in trees located on the JKI campus in Braunschweig, Lower Saxony, Germany, or near to the JKI campus (two apple trees; about 1km distance to the campus center). In total, 395 individuals from 34 bee species were sampled, including 247 honeybee (Apis mellifera) individuals. The list of sampled bee individuals contains information on sampling details (including sampling period, trap type, collector position, site), as well as information on the collected bee individuals (including operational taxon, determined genus and species based on morphological identification, sex). A second data sheet contains information on the location of the study sites.

citation.title: ALLena: Thaw depth measurements of the active layer in the Lena River Delta region from 1998 to 2022, Northeastern Siberia, detailed table 'Detailed_data_TD_Evgrafova'

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Active layer thickness (ALT) is one of currently two Essential Climate Variables related directly to permafrost regions as defined by the Global Climate Observing System (GCOS) at the World Meteorological Organization (WMO). ALT is determined as the maximum thaw depth at the end of the thawing season and is being monitored across the Arctic to better understand climate change impacts on landscape, permafrost, hydrology, vegetation, and soil biogeochemistry. In addition, spatially and/or temporally distributed measurements of thaw depth (TD) in the active layer during the thawing period are often recorded during field work in permafrost regions for various research purposes and process understanding. The ALLena dataset presents a compilation of thaw depth (TD) measurements of the active layer in the Lena River Delta region based on published and unpublished field data collected during Russian and joint German-Russian expeditions from 1998 to 2022. The dataset contains data from different areas of the Lena Delta region with clustering in research-intensive areas, e.g. in the vicinity of Research Station Samoylov Island, but also includes sites adjacent to the delta such as Muostakh Island, Bykovsky Peninsula and Tiksi settlement surroundings. The compiled data is distributed across various ecosystems and geomorphological units underlain by different types of deposits and characterized by various relief positions, microtopography, soil and vegetation cover (e.g. active floodplains, polygonal tundra on Holocene Lena Delta terraces, remnants of Yedoma Ice Complex, etc.). TD measurements were conducted as opportunistic single as well as targeted TD transects or grid measurements. For some sites measurements of TD were repeated at the same locations in different years. TD was measured one time per site or several times per site within a few centimeters to several meters to capture small-scale heterogeneity depending on e.g. microcrotopography or vegetation type. The main datatable (doi:10.1594/PANGAEA.973813) contains discrete TD values if they were measured one to three times per site. In case of more than three TD values per measurement site, the main datatable provides the minimum, maximum, and mean TD as well as the number of measurements that were averaged. For sites with more than three TD measurements per site, separate detailed tables like this one are provided. The dataset presents a highly valuable compilation of TD data over a uniquely large Arctic region and long time span. It might complement the Circumpolar Active Layer Monitoring (CALM) program and other published ALT and TD datasets for other permafrost regions and may be used for e.g. parametrization or validation of permafrost modelling and remote sensing studies.

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: Typology of agricultural land systems of Germany at a resolution of 100 hectares.

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: The decline of farmland biodiversity has widely been recognized in society and politics. Many factors that negatively affect biodiversity are associated with agriculture. European policy instruments and measures, which aimed at mitigating these impacts, have not been successful in counteracting the negative trends of farmland biodiversity. There is a growing recognition that conservation policy instruments need to be spatially targeted, given the heterogeneity of agricultural landscapes and extent of agricultural intensification in Europe. For Germany, we developed a typology of agricultural land systems (ALS) that captures the regional characteristics of agricultural intensification. For this purpose, we applied a cluster-analysis integrating indicators for land cover, landscape structure, land-use intensity, climate and relief at a resolution of with a spatial resolution of 1 km². As a result, we present a typology of eight ALS ranging from large-scale, intensive arable farming to extensive grassland/forest mosaics in mountains. The data included in this package contain the typology ALS and the corresponding values for the indicators for each hexagonal grid cell of 1 km²cell size. The typology of ALS could be used as a spatial framework for regional targeting of conservation policy instruments and for monitoring regional-specific trends of biodiversity indicators and their drivers. The data are supplement to the publication: Pingel, M; Sietz, D; Roeder, N; Klimek, S and Golla, B. (2025) Typology of Agricultural Land Systems to Support Tailored Agri-Environmental Schemes for Farmland Biodiversity: A Case Study from Germany. [Preprint]. http://dx.doi.org/10.2139/ssrn.5162566

citation.title: HODOR: Hydroacoustic and Optical Dataset for Oceanic Research: activity counts

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: HODOR (Hydroacoustic and Optical Dataset for Oceanic Research) is one of the first datasets to provide synchronized sonar and optical stereo camera videos, comprising over 400 hours of continuous recordings. The purpose of HODOR is to support the development of machine learning and deep learning algorithms for marine applications, multimodal sensor fusion techniques, biomass quantification, and long-term ecological studies. The data was collected with a stationary underwater fish observatory (UFO) in the Kiel Fjord, an inlet of the Baltic Sea in northern Germany, and includes an 86-day subset of the recordings from 2021, which was selected based on automated detections using the YOLOv5 model.

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: CLUMondoPy

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: CLUMondo is a spatially explicit land use model, which is widely used in the community of land system science. It is based on statistical analysis (location sutiability) and cellular automata (neighbourhood influence). Here, we present a translated version of the original CLUMondo to Python. The core functionalities of the original model are preserved. We rely on a combination of numpy and numba for fast computation. Moreover, we present a workflow to create location suitability maps with different machine learning methods, which can be used as inputs into CLUMondo subsequently.

citation.title: LULUCF Inventare der Bundeslaender Deutschlands

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Durch die Ratifizierung multilateraler Uebereinkommen zum Klimaschutz (z.B. UNFCCC (Klimarahmenkonvention), EU-LULUCF-Verordnung (EU 2018/841)) und durch das Bundes-Klimaschutzgesetz (KSG) hat sich Deutschland verpflichtet, die anthropogen verursachten Treibhausgasemissionen u.a. im Sektor Landnutzung, Landnutzungsaenderung und Forstwirtschaft (LULUCF) zu erfassen und jaehrlich darueber zu berichten (Klimaberichterstattung). Die Dateien enthalten Eingangsdaten und Ergebnisse der Berechnung der THG-Emissionen und der Kohlenstoffbindung des LULUCF-Sektors fuer die Jahre 1990 bis 2023, differenziert nach Bundeslaendern. Daten wurden auf einem 100 m x 100 m Raster erhoben. Die THG-Emissionen werden ausgewiesen fuer die Hauptlandnutzungskategorien Wald, Ackerland, Gruenland, Feuchtgebiete, Siedlungen und sonstiges Land sowie diverse Subkategorien sowie fuer die Pools ober- und unterirdische Biomasse, mineralische und organische Boeden, Totholz und Streu, anthropogen beeinflusste stehende und fliessende Gewaesser. Holzprodukte und off-site Emissionen aus dem Torfabbau koennen auf Ebene der Bundeslaender nicht ausgewiesen werden.

By ratifying multilateral agreements on climate protection (e.g. UNFCCC (Framework Convention on Climate Change), EU LULUCF Regulation (EU 2018/841)) and the Federal Climate Protection Act (KSG), Germany has undertaken to record anthropogenic greenhouse gas emissions in the land use, land use change and forestry (LULUCF) sector, among others, and to report on them annually (climate reporting). The files contain input data and results of the calculation of GHG emissions and carbon sequestration in the LULUCF sector for the years 1990 to 2023, differentiated by federal state. Data was collected on a 100 m x 100 m grid. The GHG emissions are shown for the main land use categories forest, arable land, grassland, wetlands, settlements and other land as well as various subcategories and for the pools above and below ground biomass, mineral and organic soils, deadwood and litter, anthropogenically influenced standing and flowing waters. Wood products and off-site emissions from peat extraction cannot be reported at federal state level.

citation.title: Yields and field management data of two adjacent organic arable crop rotations serving a dairy farm and a pig farm at the Thuenen-Institute of Organic Farming in North Germany

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: The dataset contains yields and field management data from 2019-2023 of two adjacent constant 6-field organic arable crop rotations serving a dairy farm (60 ha) and a farm with pig production (48 ha) at the research station of the Thuenen-Institute of Organic Farming, Schleswig-Holstein, Germany, respectively. The data are based on field records, weighings and analysis results of the research station. The farmland was converted to organic farming in 2001/2002 according to EU Regulation on organic production. Field locations and general settings of the crop rotations were kept constant since then. This dataset is part of the database compiled as an outcome of Work Area 1 in project OrganicYieldsUP. Variable definitions can be found here: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.15276082

Der Datensatz enthaelt Ertraege und Feldbewirtschaftungsdaten von 2019-2023 von zwei benachbarten, konstanten 6-feldrigen Bio-Ackerfruchtfolgen, die jeweils einen Milchviehbetrieb (60 ha) und einen Betrieb mit Schweineproduktion (48 ha) an der Forschungsstation des Thuenen-Instituts fuer oekologischen Landbau in Schleswig-Holstein versorgen. Die Daten basieren auf Feldaufzeichnungen, Wiegungen und Analyseergebnissen der Forschungsstation. Die landwirtschaftlichen Flaechen wurden 2001/2002 gemaess der EU-Oeko-Verordnung auf oekologischen Landbau umgestellt. Die Feldstandorte und die generellen Fruchtfolgen wurden seitdem konstant gehalten. In dieser zweiten Version dieser Datei wurde die Restfeuchte der geernteten Futterpflanzen von 33 auf 67 % korrigiert (Blatt: Ernte _tbl, Spalte: residue_moisture). Dieser Datensatz ist Teil der Datenbank, die als Ergebnis des Arbeitsbereichs 1 im Projekt OrganicYieldsUP zusammengestellt wurde. citation.title: Fatty acid patterns and stomach contents of two North Sea squid species, Loligo forbesii and Illex coindetii - [dataset]

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: With increasing temperatures in the North Sea, the local squid biomass has increased and new species have started to successfully reproduce in this area. One of these new species is the broadtail shortfin squid Illex coindetii. The squid with the so far highest biomass in the North Sea is Loligo forbesii. We investigated the fatty acid (FA) composition and analysed the stomach contents to obtain information about the prey spectra of these species. Individuals of both species were caught in July and August 2023. A total of 27 I. coindetii and 14 L. forbesii were examined for the FA composition of the mantle tissue and digestive glands (DG) as well as their stomach contents. In both species, the DG contained a higher variety and a higher content of FAs than the mantle. The FA compositions of the DG suggest moderate overlap in prey spectra of I. coindetii and L. forbesii. The stomach contents of both squid species showed a high degree of dietary overlap and contained several commercially important species As the North Sea temperatures keep rising, squids are expected to play a more important role in the regional food webs, and squids are increasingly targeted as a valuable fishery resource in the North Sea.

citation.title: CITIZEN-SDSS PROJECT: Guidelines for conducting household-level interviews in mosaic forest landscapes of the Philippines

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: This document is part of the CITIZEN-SDSS project and provides guidance on conducting household-level questionnaire interviews (HHQ) and key informant interviews (KII) in mosaic forest landscapes of the Philippines. This respository contains three documents: 1. Guidelines for conducting household-level interviews, 2. Household questionnaire template, and 3. Key informant interview template at Barangay-level. CITIZEN-SDSS is focused on fostering nature-based solutions (NBS) for sustaining and expanding the remaining forest landscapes in the Philippines by integrating local stakeholder aspirations into land use planning through spatial decision support systems (SDSS). The Philippines, with only 24% of its forest cover remaining, faces severe threats from deforestation, degradation, and climate change, despite being a global biodiversity hotspot and a vital provider of ecosystem services and livelihoods. By focusing on the Philippines, the project addresses both urgent ecological risks and pressing socio-economic needs thus, safeguarding biodiversity, supporting local communities through NBS interventions such as agroforestry, forest restoration, assisted natural regeneration (ANR), riparian buffer restoration and other sustainable land management practices. Through Citizen Science approaches and spatiotemporal modelling, CITIZEN-SDSS develops context-sensitive, scientifically rigorous pathways for sustainable land and forest management, ensuring that decision-making processes are inclusive, locally grounded, and responsive to long-term environmental and livelihood priorities.

citation.title: Yields and field management data from 13 organic farms in Germany

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: The datafile contains yields and field management data of 526 arable fields from 13 organic farms in Germany in different soil climate regions between 2008 and 2017. The data were collected in farms that have been managed organically for more than 10 years. The farms were located in the German federal states Bavaria, Brandenburg, Mecklenburg-Vorpommern, North Rhine-Westphalia and Schleswig-Holstein. The data are based on field and farm records of the farmers and were verified by plausibilitiy checks, e.g., via nutrient and mass balances. This dataset is part of the database compiled as an outcome of Work Area 1 in project OrganicYieldsUP. Variable definitions can be found here: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.15276082

Die Datei enthaelt Ertrags- und Feldbewirtschaftungsdaten von 526 Ackerflaechen von 13 Bio-Betrieben in Deutschland in verschiedenen Boden-Klima-Regionen zwischen 2008 und 2017. Die Daten wurden in landwirtschaftlichen Betrieben erhoben, die seit mehr als 10 Jahren biologisch bewirtschaftet wurden. Die Betriebe befanden sich in den Bundeslaendern Bayern, Brandenburg, Mecklenburg-Vorpommern, Nordrhein-Westfalen und Schleswig-Holstein. Die Daten basieren auf Feld- und Betriebsaufzeichnungen der Landwirte und wurden durch Plausibilitaetspruefungen, z.B. ueber Naehrstoff- und Massenbilanzen, verifiziert. citation.title: Yields and field management data of two adjacent field trials with different inputs of organic materials at the Thuenen Institute of Organic Farming in North Germany

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: The dataset contains yields and field management data of two adjacent randomised block trials from 2019 to 2021 at fixed plot locations at the research station of the Thuenen-Institute of Organic Farming in North Germany. Different techniques to enrich soil organic matter where applied in field beans, oats and silage maize (trial CF1) or in spring wheat, oats and silage maize (trial CF4). Both field trials followed spring wheat. In trial CF 1 undersown clover grass and harvest residues were incorporated or not. In trial CF4 different organic materials where applied to the soil before cultivation and seeding in spring. This dataset is part of the database compiled as an outcome of Work Area 1 in project OrganicYieldsUP. Variable definitions can be found here: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.15276082

Verschiedene Techniken zur Anreicherung der organischen Substanz des Bodens wurden bei Ackerbohnen, Hafer und Silomais (Versuch CF1) oder bei Sommerweizen, Hafer und Silomais (Versuch CF4) angewendet. Beide Feldversuche folgten auf Sommerweizen. Im Versuch CF 1 wurden untergesaetes Kleegras und Ernterueckstaende eingearbeitet oder nicht. Im Versuch CF4 wurden verschiedene organische Materialien vor dem Anbau und der Aussaat im Fruehjahr auf den Boden aufgebracht. citation.title: PAH-Metaboliten in Fischen aus der Nord- und Ostsee (2023)

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Polyaromatische Kohlenwasserstoffe (PAH) sind Bestandteil fossiler Energietraeger und haben natuerliche und anthropogene Quellen. Man findet sie in der Umwelt zum Beispiel in der Naehe von Haefen oder Schifffahrtsrouten. Zur Gruppe der PAH gehoeren auch krebserregende Substanzen. Fische metabolisieren PAH sehr schnell, so dass PAH selbst in Fischen kaum nachweisbar sind, wohl aber ihre Metaboliten in der Galle des Fisches. Die Gehalte von PAK-Metaboliten in Meeresfisch werden im Rahmen des Umwelt-Monitorings des Thuenen-Instituts fuer Fischereioekologie regelmaessig ueberwacht, um die Hoehe der PAK-Belastung indirekt zu erfassen und zu bewerten sowie regionale und zeitliche Unterschiede in dieser Belastung festzustellen. Die Ergebnisse fliessen in nationale und europaeische Umweltbewertungen ein. Die Daten sind Teil des Monitorings im Thuenen-Institut fuer Fischereioekologie und sind als solche ueber die ICES-Datenbank Dome oeffentlich zugaenglich. Erlaeuterungen zu den ICES Codes in der angehaengten Datei findet man hier: https://www.ices.dk/data/vocabularies/Pages/default.aspx

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: How to define and measure substitution effects in bioeconomy: A scoping review - Data Set

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: This dataset contains material related to a scoping review conducted on substitution effects within bioeconomy. The aim of the scoping review is to identify definitions and methodological approaches used for the quantification of substitution effects for application in a bioeconomy monitoring framework. The scoping review was conducted guided by the 27-item checklist framework indicated on the Preferred Reporting Item for Systematic Reviews and Meta-Analysis (PRISMA) extension for scoping reviews, PRISMA-ScR. It searched for literature in two databases (Web of Science and Scopus) using bioeconomy-related search strings and keywords and spanning twenty-two and a half years (after 1999 until 2022) of scientific literature. The final selection includes 57 peer-reviewed articles published in English. The material includes the data extraction template, identification information from each article, summarized data extracted from articles as these relate to research questions and objectives of this review, verbatim explicit and implicit definitions as these were presented in the selected articles, as well as the displacement factors (from literature or authors` estimations) employed by the authors to analyze substitution effects.

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: Per- und Polyfluoralkylchemikalien (PFAS) in Fischen aus der Nord- und Ostsee (2023)

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Per- und Polyfluoralkylchemikalien (PFAS) sind industriell hergestellte persistente fluorierte organische Substanzen, die z.B. zur Ausruestung von Textilien, in Farben, in Kosmetika und in Feuerloeschmitteln verwendet werden. Sie sind weltweit verbreitet und wurden z.B. in Eisbaeren gefunden. Einige PFAS stehen im Verdacht krebserregend zu sein oder das Immunsystem zu beeinflussen. Gehalte von PFAS in Meeresfisch sind oft in der Naehe der analytischen Nachweisgrenze. In kuestennahen Gebieten und Aestuarien sind die PFAS-Gehalte hoeher. PFAS werden im Rahmen des Umwelt-Monitorings des Thuenen-Instituts fuer Fischereioekologie regelmaessig ueberwacht, um die Hoehe der Belastung zu erfassen und zu bewerten sowie regionale und zeitliche Unterschiede in dieser Belastung festzustellen. Die Ergebnisse fliessen in nationale und europaeische Umweltbewertungen ein. Ein Teil der Daten wurde im Rahmen des Projekts „Per- und Polyfluoralkylchemikalien (PFAS) in Fischen aus deutschen Kuestengebieten (PFAS-FISCH)' mit erweitertem PFAS-Spektrum erhoben.

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: Jaehrliche Abfrage der Forstressorts der Bundeslaender zu stillgelegten Waldflaechen - 2023 -2025

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Das Thuenen-Institut fuer Waldwirtschaft ist, im Auftrag des Statistischen Bundesamts, zustaendig fuer die Erstellung der Waldgesamtrechnung (WGR) als Teil der Umweltoekonomischen Gesamtrechnung der Bundesrepublik Deutschland und als Teil der EU-weiten European Forest Accounts. In der WGR werden in 10 Tabellen die Ressource Wald und ihr Produkt Holz von der Flaeche ueber den physischen Vorrat, dessen Wert und Nutzungen, bis hin zur Verarbeitung des Holzes in der Holzindustrie, dargestellt. Tabelle A 1a Area of wooded land in 1000 ha der WGR beinhaltet die physische Waldflaechenbilanz. Dort wird die gesamte deutsche Waldflaeche im jeweiligen Berichtsjahr, sowie die landwirtschaftliche Flaeche, die fuer die Produktion von Holz eingesetzt, abgebildet. Die Flaeche wird hierbei unterteilt nach 1.) Flaechen, die fuer die Rohholzproduktion zur Verfuegung stehen (FAWS), 2.) Flaechen, die fuer die Rohholzproduktion nicht zur Verfuegung stehen (FNAWS), 3.) sonstige Waldflaechen (in Deutschland nicht relevant) und 4.) sonstige bestockte Flaechen die fuer die Rohholzproduktion zur Verfuegung stehen (Code 3, hierunter fallen z.B. Agroforstflaechen und Kurzumtriebsplantagen). Die FNAWS-Flaeche besteht aus Waldflaechen auf denen z.B. wegen rechtlicher Beschraenkungen oder durch politische Vorgaben eine Rohholzproduktion kaum oder gar nicht moeglich ist (z.B. Stilllegungsflaechen) und aus Waldflaechen, auf denen die Wuchsleistung oder die Holzqualitaet so gering oder die Holzernte- und Holzbringungskosten so hoch sind, dass eine Rohholzproduktion kaum moeglich ist. Fuer die Berechnung der jaehrlichen Aenderungen der FNAWS-Waldflaeche in Tabelle A1a werden in den fuer Forstwirtschaft zustaendigen Ministerien der Bundeslaender jaehrlich Daten zu den Waldflaechen erhoben, auf denen im jeweiligen WGR-Berichtsjahr dauerhaft die forstliche Nutzung eingestellt wurde (Stilllegungsflaechen). Als Stilllegungsflaechen werden alle, aufgrund von gesetzlichen Schutzgebietsausweisungen dauerhaft aus der forstlichen Nutzung genommenen Waldflaechen verstanden (hierunter fallen z.B. Kernzonen von Nationalparks oder Bannwaelder).

citation.title: Litterfall data and hemispherical photos for LAI-calculation on an oak stand at the Intensive Forest Monitoring Station Britz, Brandenburg, 2024 - 2025

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: eDNAcheck: Assessing the plausibility of species detections in molecular biodiversity data

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Molecular biodiversity surveys, such as environmental DNA (eDNA) and metabarcoding, often generate species detections that require ecological verification. eDNAcheck is an online tool designed to assess the plausibility of such detections by comparing user-provided species or genus records with reference occurrence data from global biodiversity repositories--including the Ocean Biodiversity Information System (OBIS) and the Global Biodiversity Information Facility (GBIF)--as well as custom datasets. The tool standardizes taxonomic, spatial, and temporal information, applies user-defined spatial and temporal buffers, retrieves matching occurrence records via the OBIS API, and summarizes results in a downloadable file accompanied by an interactive map. By highlighting ecologically plausible detections, potential range extensions, and records that warrant further scrutiny, eDNAcheck supports quality control, biodiversity monitoring, and conservation decision-making. The web-based interface requires no installation and accepts common tabular formats (.csv*, .xlsx, .tab). A global repository comparison is currently implemented, with custom-database validation in development. eDNAcheck facilitates transparent, reproducible contextualization of molecular biodiversity data, enabling researchers and practitioners to better interpret species detections in a global biogeographic framework.

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: Crop yields and area in Germany at a harmonized district-level from 1979. Update to 2024.

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: In this publication we provide a dataset with crop yield and area for Germany from 1979 to 2024. This data set is an update to https://doi.org/10.3220/DATA20231117103252-0. The data are spatially resolved to 397 districts with an average size of 900 km2 and include the crops spring barley, winter barley, grain maize, silage maize, oats, potatoes, winter rape, rye, sugar beet, triticale and winter wheat. The crop-yield data cover on average about 9.5 million hectares per year and 80% of Germany's total arable land. The final dataset contains 220,850 yield and area data points. These were obtained by collecting and digitizing crop data from multiple statistical sources and transforming the data to match the district boundaries in 2020. A comprehensive description and validation of the dataset up to 2021 is published in Scientific Data by Duden et al. (2024); https://doi.org/10.1038/s41597-024-02951-8. We therefore recommend that you also refer the Scientific Data article when using the dataset. Suggested citation: The data is based on Offermann und Duden (2025), which provides an update to the data publication by Duden et al. (2024).

In dieser Veroeffentlichung stellen wir einen Datensatz mit Ertraegen und Anbauflaechen fuer Deutschland von 1979 bis 2024 zur Verfuegung. Dieser Datensatz stellt eine Aktualisierung von https://doi.org/10.3220/DATA20231117103252-0 dar. Die Daten sind raeumlich aufgeloest auf 397 Landkreise mit einer durchschnittlichen Groesse von 900 km2 und beinhalten die Fruchtarten Sommergerste, Wintergerste, Koernermais, Silomais, Hafer, Kartoffeln, Winterraps, Roggen, Zuckerrueben, Triticale und Winterweizen. Sie umfassen im Durchschnitt etwa 9,5 Mio. ha pro Jahr und damit 80 % der gesamten deutschen Ackerflaeche. Der finale Datensatz enthaelt 220.850 Datenpunkte. Die Daten wurden aus mehreren statistischen Quellen gesammelt und digitalisiert und anschliessend von uns transformiert, so dass sie alle raeumlich harmonisiert fuer die Landkreisgrenzen von 2020 vorliegen. Eine umfassende Beschreibung und Validierung des Datensatzes bis 2021 ist publiziert in Scientific Data (Duden et al., 2024) ; https://doi.org/10.1038/s41597-024-02951-8. Wir empfehlen daher, bei einer Verwendung des Datensatzes auch auf den Scientific Data-Artikel zu verweisen. Empfohlene Zitierweise: Die Ertragsdaten basieren auf Offermann und Duden (2025), einer Aktualisierung der Datenpublikation von Duden et al. (2024).

citation.title: Data used for analysis of extreme precipitation events and their Impact on summer deep seepage on the Intensive Forest Monitoring Station Britz

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Time series of precipitation, deep seepage and soil water content of the Intensive Forest Monitoring Station Britz. 3 tree stands of beech (1974), oak (1999) and Scots pine (1974). Daily deep seepage measured with large scale lysimeters in 5 meter depth, timeseries from 2010/01/01 to 2022/12/31 stored in daily_deep_seepage_in_mm.csv column explanation: 'date': 'date in format 'yyyy-mm-dd' ' 'deep_seepage_beech': 'daily deep seepage under beech lysimeter in mm/day' 'deep_seepage_oak_young': 'daily deep seepage under oak(young) lysimeter in mm/day' 'deep_seepage_pine': 'daily deep seepage under pine lysimeter in mm/day' 'comments': 'comments' Daily precipitation measured with tipping bucket with magnetic reed switch (by LAMBRECHT meteo GmbH; type: 15189, resolution: 0.1 mm accuracy: ± 2 %), based on the Hellmann design. The devices are installed at one metre above ground level on open field; systematic precipitation measurement errors were corrected after Richter (1995). Timeseries from 1993/01/01 to 2022/12/31 stored in daily_precipitation_in_mm.csv column explanation: 'date': 'date in format 'yyyy-mm-dd' ' 'p': 'precipitation from open field in measured in 1 m hight, in mm/day' 'p_cor': 'corrected precipitation in mm/day after Richter (1995), Ergebnisse methodischer Untersuchungen zur Korrektur des systematischen Messfehlers des Hellmann-Niederschlagsmessers. Berichte des Deutschen Wetterdienstes, Vol 194. Deutsche Wetterdienst, Offenbach am Main' Water content is measured in 10 depths to 4.6 m with three sensors on every depth and plot with Sentek EnviroSCAN tube sensors using the electrical capacitance. This time series is the aggregated water in the soil profile from 0 to 5 meters, averaged over 30 sensors. Timeseries from 2017/11/01 to 2021/12/31 stored in soil_water_content_in_mm.csv column explanation: 'timestamp':'date time in format 'yyyy-mm-dd hh:MM:ss' ' 'wc_beech':'soil water content under beech stand aggregated from 0 m - 5 m in mm' 'wc_pine':'soil water content under pine stand aggregated from 0 m - 5 m in mm' 'wc_oak':'soil water content under oak(young) stand aggregated from 0 m - 5 m in mm'

citation.title: Country-specific calculation of potential forest area (PFA)

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: This package processes the model outputs from Bonannella et al. (2023), which provide spatially detailed global projections of potential natural vegetation (PNV) areas under three different climate change scenarios (RCP 2.6, 4.5, and 8.5) (van Vuuren et al. 2011) until 2080 (Bonnanella et al. 2023). We focus on processing these results (using TIFF files) to derive forest area estimates at the country level. The package begins with aggregating the data by country and adjusting forest definitions to match biome types and IUCN classifications, as provided in the dataset under PNV areas. The projections are converted to EPSG 8857 and then clipped with country data provided by geopandas at a 1x1 km pixel resolution. This allows us to derive country-specific areas in km². A toolbox is included to validate the results with alternative datasets (e.g., WDI). The package offers flexibility, enabling users to analyze not only the Bonanella et al. (2023) data but also other spatial maps using Python. Additionally, we examine how forest areas within countries and continents change up to 2080, focusing on both increases and decreases across various time frames. This tool can support long-term international forest and policy modelling, similar to other projects that leverage complex datasets for future scenario analysis. Bonannella, Carmelo; Hengl, Tomislav; Parente, Leandro; Bruin, Sytze de (2023): Biomes of the world under climate change scenarios: increasing aridity and higher temperatures lead to significant shifts in natural vegetation. In PeerJ 11, e15593. DOI: 10.7717/peerj.15593 . Van Vuuren, D.P., Edmonds, J., Kainuma, M. et al. The representative concentration pathways: an overview. Climatic Change 109, 5 (2011). https://doi.org/10.1007/s10584-011-0148-z

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: Agricultural land use (raster): National-scale crop type maps for Germany from combined time series of Sentinel-2 and Landsat data (2024)

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: The dataset contains a map of the main classes of agricultural land use (dominant crop types and other land use types) in Germany for the year 2024. It complements a series of maps that are produced annually at the Thuenen Institute beginning with the year 2017 on the basis of satellite data. The maps cover the entire open landscape, i.e., the agriculturally used area (UAA) and e.g., uncultivated areas. Data and methods used to create map versions v301/2 differ from those used in previous versions. The v301/2 maps were derived from a time series of Sentinel-2 and Landsat 8/9 images. Map production is based on the methods described in Pham et al. (2024). All optical satellite data were managed, pre-processed and structured in an analysis-ready data (ARD) cube using the open-source software FORCE - Framework for Operational Radiometric Correction for Environmental monitoring (Frantz, D., 2019), in which SAR and environmental data were integrated. The map extent covers all areas in Germany that are defined as agricultural land, grassland, small woody features, heathland, peatland or unvegetated areas according to ATKIS Basis-DLM (Geobasisdaten: © GeoBasis-DE / BKG, 2020). Version v301: Post-processing of the maps included a sieve filter as well as a ruleset for the reduction of non-plausible areas using the Basis-DLM and the digital terrain model of Germany (Geobasisdaten: © GeoBasis-DE / BKG, 2015). Version v302: Additional post-processing was performed to detect and mask additional non-plausible areas that were not adequately covered by the first post-processing (e.g., areas with sparse vegetation, montane forests) based on the „Oekosystematlas Deutschland' (© Statistisches Bundesamt, Deutschland, 2024). As a consequence, the current version includes a new class 'Small woody features on other land'. Furthermore, the class 'permanent grassland' was refinded. Each pixel that was classified as 'cultivated grassland' in at least five years (between 2017 and 2022) was translated to 'permanent grassland' in the annual maps. Validation: The final maps were validated using all pixels of the publicly available IACS parcels from the federal states of Brandenburg, Lower Saxony, and North Rhine-Westphalia that were not used for model training. Classes that are underrepresented in these federal states could therefore not be adequately evaluated (e.g., hops and grapevines). We provide this dataset 'as is' without any warranty regarding the accuracy or completeness and exclude all liability. The maps are available as cloud optimized GeoTiffs, which makes downloading the full dataset optional. All data can directly be accessed in QGIS, R, Python or any supported software of your choice using the URL that will be provided on request. By doing so the entire map area or only the regions of interest can be accessed. QGIS legend files for data visualization can be downloaded separately. References: Pham, V.-D., Tetteh, G., Thiel, F., Erasmi, S., Schwieder, M., Frantz, D., & van der Linden, S. (2024). Temporally transferable crop mapping with temporal encoding and deep learning augmentations. International Journal of Applied Earth Observation and Geoinformation, 129, 103867. BKG, Bundesamt fuer Kartographie und Geodaesie (2015). Digitales Gelaendemodell Gitterweite 10 m. DGM10. https://sg.geodatenzentrum.de/web_public/gdz/dokumentation/deu/dgm10.pdf (last accessed: 28. April 2022). BKG, Bundesamt fuer Kartographie und Geodaesie (2020). Digitales Basis-Landschaftsmodell. https://sg.geodatenzentrum.de/web_public/gdz/dokumentation/deu/basis-dlm.pdf (last accessed: 28. April 2022). Frantz, D. (2019). FORCE--Landsat + Sentinel-2 Analysis Ready Data and Beyond. Remote Sensing, 11, 1124. Statistisches Bundesamt, Deutschland (2024). Oekosystematlas Deutschland https://oekosystematlas-ugr.destatis.de/ (last accessed: 08.02.2024). ______________________________________________________________________ Agricultural land use (raster): National-scale crop type maps for Germany from combined time series of Sentinel-2 and Landsat data (2024) (Version v302) © 2025 by Tetteh, G. O., Schwieder, M., Blickensdoerfer, L., Gocht, A., & Erasmi, S.; licensed under CC BY 4.0. Funding was provided by the German Federal Ministry of Food and Agriculture as part of the joint project 'Monitoring der biologischen Vielfalt in Agrarlandschaften' (MonViA, Monitoring of biodiversity in agricultural landscapes).

citation.title: Agricultural land use (raster): National-scale crop type maps for Germany from combined time series of Sentinel-2 and Landsat data (2024)

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Note: This dataset contains the same information as 10.5281/zenodo.17190438 but with new pyramids for improved visualization. The dataset contains a map of the main classes of agricultural land use (dominant crop types and other land use types) in Germany for the year 2024. It complements a series of maps that are produced annually at the Thuenen Institute beginning with the year 2017 on the basis of satellite data. The maps cover the entire open landscape, i.e., the agriculturally used area (UAA) and e.g., uncultivated areas. Data and methods used to create map versions v301/2 differ from those used in previous versions. The v301/2 maps were derived from a time series of Sentinel-2 and Landsat 8/9 images. Map production is based on the methods described in Pham et al. (2024). All optical satellite data were managed, pre-processed and structured in an analysis-ready data (ARD) cube using the open-source software FORCE - Framework for Operational Radiometric Correction for Environmental monitoring (Frantz, D., 2019), in which SAR and environmental data were integrated. The map extent covers all areas in Germany that are defined as agricultural land, grassland, small woody features, heathland, peatland or unvegetated areas according to ATKIS Basis-DLM (Geobasisdaten: © GeoBasis-DE / BKG, 2020). Version v301: Post-processing of the maps included a sieve filter as well as a ruleset for the reduction of non-plausible areas using the Basis-DLM and the digital terrain model of Germany (Geobasisdaten: © GeoBasis-DE / BKG, 2015). Version v302: Additional post-processing was performed to detect and mask additional non-plausible areas that were not adequately covered by the first post-processing (e.g., areas with sparse vegetation, montane forests) based on the „Oekosystematlas Deutschland' (© Statistisches Bundesamt, Deutschland, 2024). As a consequence, the current version includes a new class 'Small woody features on other land'. Furthermore, the class 'permanent grassland' was refinded. Each pixel that was classified as 'cultivated grassland' in at least five years (between 2017 and 2022) was translated to 'permanent grassland' in the annual maps. Validation: The final maps were validated using all pixels of the publicly available IACS parcels from the federal states of Brandenburg, Lower Saxony, and North Rhine-Westphalia that were not used for model training. Classes that are underrepresented in these federal states could therefore not be adequately evaluated (e.g., hops and grapevines). We provide this dataset 'as is' without any warranty regarding the accuracy or completeness and exclude all liability. The maps are available as cloud optimized GeoTiffs, which makes downloading the full dataset optional. All data can directly be accessed in QGIS, R, Python or any supported software of your choice using the URL that will be provided on request. By doing so the entire map area or only the regions of interest can be accessed. QGIS legend files for data visualization can be downloaded separately. citation.title: High-Resolution Maps (10 m) of Cropland Soil Organic Carbon and Clay in Germany based on Sentinel-2 Data

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: This dataset contains predictions and uncertainty maps of the cropland soil organic carbon and clay, derived at a 10 m resolution for Germany. The following soil properties were mapped using topsoil samples (0 - 30 cm) from the German Agricultural Soil Inventory (BZE-LW) (Poeplau et al. 2020): Soil organic carbon stock (Mg ha-1) Soil organic carbon content (g kg-1) Clay content (mass%) Support vector machines were trained based on a 10 m Sentinel-2 Bare Soil Composite, using the methods described in Broeg et al. (2025, PREPRINT). Uncertainty maps were derived based on the 95 % prediction intervals (standard deviation × 1.96) of the cross-validation models. The map extent covers all areas in Germany that are defined as agricultural land, according to ATKIS Basis-DLM (Geobasisdaten: © GeoBasis-DE / BKG, 2025). Raster maps are provided as Cloud Optimized GeoTIFF (COG). References BKG, Bundesamt fuer Kartographie und Geodaesie (2025). Digitales Basis-Landschaftsmodell. https://sg.geodatenzentrum.de/web_public/gdz/dokumentation/deu/basis-dlm.pdf (last accessed: 15. May 2025). Broeg, T., Don, A., Scholten, T., Erasmi, S. (2025). Reducing Bias in Cropland Soil Organic Carbon and Clay Predictions using Sentinel-2 Composites and Data Balancing. https://doi.org/10.31223/X50M91 Poeplau, C., Jacobs, A., Don, A., Vos, C., Schneider, F., Wittnebel, M., Tiemeyer, B., Heidkamp, A., Prietz, R., & Flessa, H. (2020). Stocks of organic carbon in German agricultural soils--Key results of the first comprehensive inventory. Journal of Plant Nutrition and Soil Science, 183(6), 665-681. https://doi.org/10.1002/jpln.202000113

citation.title: Bare Soil Composite for Germany (10 m) based on Sentinel-2 data from 2015 to 2024

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: This dataset contains the soil reflectance composite for Germany, which is described in Broeg et. al (2025, PREPRINT). The open-source software FORCE (Frantz, 2019) was used to download and preprocess all available Sentinel-2A/B scenes from February to November (2015 to 2024). A data fusion algorithm was applied to increase the spatial resolution of the 20-meter Sentinel-2 bands (B5, B6, B7, B8a, B11, B12) to a common resolution of 10 meters (Frantz et al., 2016). Clouds, cloud shadows, and hazy transition zones were detected and removed using a modified version of the Fmask algorithm (Frantz, 2019). Bare soil observations were filtered from the preprocessed time series using the Normalized Burn Ratio 2 (NBR2 < 0.16) and a modified vegetation index (PV+IR2 < 0.24), proposed by Heiden et. al (2022). The soil reflectance was derived for the ten Sentinel-2 bands (B02, B03, B04, B05, B06, B07, B08, B08a, B11, B12) by calculating band-wise mean values across the filtered observations. The map extent covers all areas in Germany that are defined as agricultural land, according to ATKIS Basis-DLM (Geobasisdaten: © GeoBasis-DE / BKG, 2025). Raster maps are provided as Cloud Optimized GeoTIFF (COG). References BKG, Bundesamt fuer Kartographie und Geodaesie (2025). Digitales Basis-Landschaftsmodell. https://sg.geodatenzentrum.de/web_public/gdz/dokumentation/deu/basis-dlm.pdf (last accessed: 15. May 2025). Broeg, T., Don, A., Scholten, T., Erasmi, S., (2025, PREPRINT). Reducing Bias in Cropland Soil Organic Carbon and Clay Predictions using Sentinel-2 Composites and Data Balancing. https://doi.org/10.31223/X50M91 Frantz, D. (2019). FORCE--Landsat + Sentinel-2 Analysis Ready Data and Beyond. Remote Sensing, 11(9), 1124. https://doi.org/10.3390/rs11091124 Frantz, D., Stellmes, M., Roder, A., Udelhoven, T., Mader, S., & Hill, J. (2016). Improving the Spatial Resolution of Land Surface Phenology by Fusing Medium- and Coarse-Resolution Inputs. IEEE Transactions on Geoscience and Remote Sensing, 54(7), 4153-4164. https://doi.org/10.1109/TGRS.2016.2537929 Heiden, U., d'Angelo, P., Schwind, P., Karlshoefer, P., Mueller, R., Zepp, S., Wiesmeier, M., & Reinartz, P. (2022). Soil Reflectance Composites--Improved Thresholding and Performance Evaluation. Remote Sensing, 14(18), 4526. https://doi.org/10.3390/rs14184526

citation.title: Trophic ecology of squids in the Benguela Upwelling System assessed through stomach content, fatty acid and stable isotopes analyses in austral spring 2021 - Stable isotope baseline measurements

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: For stable isotope baseline measurements, the primarily herbivorous copepod Nannocalanus minor was collected during the research cruise SO285 on RV Sonne in the northern (nBUS) and southern (sBUS) Benguela Upwelling System between September 15 and October 7, 2021. The cruise was part of the TRAFFIC (Trophic tRAnsfer eFFICiency in the Benguela Current) project. Samples were retrieved from vertical multinet 'Midi' hauls (200 µm mesh size) at 1 station in the nBUS (0-50 m depth) and 2 stations in the sBUS (50-100 m and 0-50 m depth respectively). In total, 3 samples were obtained from the nBUS and 6 from the sBUS. Stable isotope measurements of the copepod were then used as baseline values for further analyses in the study.

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: Thuenen-Einschlagsrueckrechnung 2024

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Der jaehrliche Holzeinschlag in der Bundesrepublik Deutschland ist die zentrale Groesse zur Nutzung der Ressource Holz und damit eine wesentliche Kennzahl fuer die Beurteilung von Nachhaltigkeit und fuer die Abschaetzung ungenutzter Rohholzpotenziale. Zusaetzlich dient die Groesse der Ermittlung der Kohlenstoffspeicherung in Wald und Holz. Die amtliche Einschlagstatistik unterschaetzt den tatsaechlichen Einschlag erheblich. Ein durch das Thuenen-Institut in Zusammenarbeit mit der Universitaet Hamburg modifiziertes und weiterentwickeltes Verfahren zur verwendungsseitigen Abschaetzung der Holzeinschlaege ermoeglicht nun die Ermittlung realistischerer Jahresdaten fuer den Zeitraum von 1995 bis heute. Im Mittel werden durch die amtliche Einschlagsstatistik ueber den gesamten Betrachtungszeitraum nur etwa 81 % des tatsaechlichen Einschlages erfasst. Das bedeutet, dass durchschnittlich jaehrlich ca. 13,0 Mio. m³ Holzeinschlag nicht erfasst wurden. Die Ergebnisse der verwendungsseitigen Rueckrechnung weichen im Durchschnitt (2003 - 2012) um etwa 1,9 Mio. Kubikmeter (Erntefestmeter ohne Rinde) bzw. um ca. 2,5 % von den Ergebnissen der dritten Bundeswaldinventur (BWI3 2014) ab. Allerdings zeigt sich, dass sich der Holzeinschlag nach der amtlichen Einschlagsstatistik in den letzten Jahren zeitweise dem berechneten Holzeinschlag naehert, aber aktuell wieder deutlich niedriger liegt. Auch die Ergebnisse der vierten Bundeswaldinventur bestaetigen erneut die Ergebnisse der Thuenen-Einschlagsrueckrechnung. Eine relevante Groesse fuer die verwendungsseitige Berechnung des Holzeinschlags sind die Bestandsveraenderungen der Rohholzlager im Wald. Leider liegen hierfuer keine direkten Angaben aus Statistik oder Literatur vor. Waldlagerdaten fuer die Jahre 2003-2015 koennen aus dem Testbetriebsnetz Forstwirtschaft (TBN-Forst) des Bundes abgeleitet werden. Als Grundlage fuer die Schaetzung fuer die Jahre ab 2016 dient die enge Korrelation der Waldlager mit den Industrielagern. Es ist moeglich, dass dieser Zusammenhang gerade in den vergangenen Schadjahren ab 2018 nicht zutrifft und im Wald deutlich andere Mengen eingelagert wurden. In der Literatur bzw. aktuellen Pressemeldungen finden sich jedoch keine Hinweise auf besonders hohe Einlagerungsaktivitaeten; moeglicherweise, weil ein groesserer Teil des Schadholzes nur bedingt fuer Einlagerung geeignet oder die Wirtschaftlichkeit nicht gegeben ist. Zwar wird von hohen Schadholzmengen berichtet, jedoch bedeutet dies nicht auch einen hohen Schadholzeinschlag. Es gibt Hinweise darauf, dass grosse Schadholzmengen zeitweise nicht aufgearbeitet bzw. gefaellt wurden. Fuer die aktuelle Schaetzung der Lagerveraenderungen im Wald haben wir daher die Korrelation zum Industrielager, fuer das Daten in der amtlichen Statistik vorliegen, beibehalten. Eine hoehere Einlagerung wuerde sich in der verwendungsseitigen Einschlagsrueckrechnung direkt in einer Erhoehung des Holzeinschlags auswirken, eine niedrigere Einlagerung wuerde rechnerisch eine Verringerung des Holzeinschlags bewirken. Hinweis: Aufgrund neuer Eingangsgroessen in die Berechnungen sowie der Verwendung von Regressionsmodellen aendern sich in aller Regel auch die berechneten Werte der Vorjahre.

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: Trophic ecology of squids in the Benguela Upwelling System assessed through stomach content, fatty acid and stable isotopes analyses in austral spring 2021 - Fatty acid contents of squids

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Squids were collected during the research cruise SO285 on RV Sonne in the northern (nBUS) and southern (sBUS) Benguela Upwelling System between September 13 and October 9, 2021 in order to determine their trophic position and nutritional ecology. The cruise was part of the TRAFFIC (Trophic tRAnsfer eFFICiency in the Benguela Current) project. Samples were retrieved from rectangular midwater trawl (RMT) net hauls at 10 stations in the nBUS (sampling ranged from surface down to 230-600 m) and 7 stations in the sBUS (sampling ranged from surface down to 500-750 m). Furthermore, some squids were caught using hook and line in the upper two meters of the water column at 2 stations in the nBUS (ranging from 20 to 115 min per station, 4-5 rods) and 4 stations in the sBUS (ranging from 45 to 105 min per station, 4-6 rods). At 1 station in sBUS one squid was retrieved from a neuston catamaran haul (NCAT) used to sample the surface layer (0-20 cm sampling depth). Dorsal mantle length (DML) of each specimen was measured to the nearest mm below. This data set contains the results of the fatty acid trophic marker analyses of squid mantle muscle and midgut gland (MGG) tissue of 84 specimens. A modified carnivory index after Bode et al. (2015) was determined and ranged from 0.55 to 0.92. Differences in fatty acid compositions displayed distinct clusters separating squid families and different prey taxa through principal component analyses.

Each pixel that was classified as 'cultivated grassland' in at least five years (between 2017 and 2022) was translated to 'permanent grassland' in the annual maps. Validation: The final maps were validated using all pixels of the publicly available IACS parcels from the federal states of Brandenburg, Lower Saxony, and North Rhine-Westphalia that were not used for model training. Classes that are underrepresented in these federal states could therefore not be adequately evaluated (e.g., hops and grapevines). We provide this dataset 'as is' without any warranty regarding the accuracy or completeness and exclude all liability. The maps are available as cloud optimized GeoTiffs, which makes downloading the full dataset optional. All data can directly be accessed in QGIS, R, Python or any supported software of your choice using the URL that will be provided on request. By doing so the entire map area or only the regions of interest can be accessed. QGIS legend files for data visualization can be downloaded separately. References: Pham, V.-D., Tetteh, G., Thiel, F., Erasmi, S., Schwieder, M., Frantz, D., & van der Linden, S. (2024). April 2022). BKG, Bundesamt fuer Kartographie und Geodaesie (2020). Digitales Basis-Landschaftsmodell. https://sg.geodatenzentrum.de/web_public/gdz/dokumentation/deu/basis-dlm.pdf (last accessed: 28. April 2022). Frantz, D. (2019). FORCE--Landsat + Sentinel-2 Analysis Ready Data and Beyond. Remote Sensing, 11, 1124. Statistisches Bundesamt, Deutschland (2024). Oekosystematlas Deutschland https://oekosystematlas-ugr.destatis.de/ (last accessed: 08.02.2024).

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: Trophic ecology of squids in the Benguela Upwelling System assessed through stomach content, fatty acid and stable isotopes analyses in austral spring 2021 - Stomach contents of squids

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Squids were collected during the research cruise SO285 on RV Sonne in the northern (nBUS) and southern (sBUS) Benguela Upwelling System between September 13 and October 8, 2021 in order to determine their trophic position and nutritional ecology. The cruise was part of the TRAFFIC (Trophic tRAnsfer eFFICiency in the Benguela Current) project. Samples were retrieved from rectangular midwater trawl (RMT) net hauls at 8 stations in the nBUS (sampling ranged from surface down to 230-600 m) and 5 stations in the sBUS (sampling ranged from surface down to 500-750 m). Furthermore, some squids were caught using hook and line in the upper two meters of the water column at 2 stations in the nBUS (ranging from 20 to 115 min per station, 4-5 rods) and 4 stations in the sBUS (ranging from 45 to 105 min per station, 4-6 rods). At 1 station in sBUS one squid was retrieved from a neuston catamaran haul (NCAT) used to sample the surface layer (0-20 cm sampling depth). Dorsal mantle length (DML) of each specimen was measured to the nearest mm below. Visual stomach content analyses of 53 stomachs from chosen epi- and mesopelagic squid species were performed using a stereo-microscope (7.5-50x magnification). Stomach content analyses showed that squid species preyed on a variety of organisms ranging from crustaceans to lanternfishes (Myctophidae) and flying squids (Ommastrephidae).

citation.title: Trophic ecology of squids in the Benguela Upwelling System assessed through stomach content, fatty acid and stable isotopes analyses in austral spring 2021 - Stable isotope measurements of squids

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Squids were collected during the research cruise SO285 on RV Sonne in the northern (nBUS) and southern (sBUS) Benguela Upwelling System between September 13 and October 9, 2021 in order to determine their trophic position and nutritional ecology. The cruise was part of the TRAFFIC (Trophic tRAnsfer eFFICiency in the Benguela Current) project. Samples were retrieved from rectangular midwater trawl (RMT) net hauls at 10 stations in the nBUS (sampling ranged from surface down to 230-600 m) and 6 stations in the sBUS (sampling ranged from surface down to 500-555 m). Furthermore, some squids were caught using hook and line in the upper two meters of the water column at 2 stations in the nBUS (ranging from 20 to 115 min per station, 4-5 rods) and 4 stations in the sBUS (ranging from 45 to 105 min per station, 4-6 rods). At 1 station in sBUS one squid was retrieved from a neuston catamaran haul (NCAT) used to sample the surface layer (0-20 cm sampling depth). Dorsal mantle length (DML) of each specimen was measured to the nearest mm below. Mantle muscle tissue sample was taken from 82 squid specimens for stable isotope analyses (SIA). SIA revealed significant differences in δ15N values of small squids (dorsal mantle length 10 cm). Trophic position estimates based on Post (2002) ranged from 2.2 to 5.0. Isotopic niche width was widest in the families Ommastrephidae and Cranchiidae.

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: The Immunomodulatory Effects of Physical Enrichment in Rainbow Trout (Oncorhynchus mykiss)

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Environmental enrichment refers to the addition of stimuli or modifications to captive environments that promote the expression of natural behaviours and enhance animal welfare. While enrichment has the potential to enhance welfare, its effects on fish immune function remain unclear. This study examined whether enrichment modulates the immune system beyond welfare benefits. Growth (length, weight, and Fulton's body condition factor - K), immune parameters (leukocyte counts and respiratory burst activity), and serum markers (cortisol, myeloperoxidase, antiprotease, lysozyme) were assessed in rainbow trout (Oncorhynchus mykiss, n = 240). Trout (20 per aquarium, initial weight: 9.84 ± 0.77 g) were reared for 48 days in four conditions: horizontal (H) (gravel), vertical (V) (rubber cords), combined (VH), or a control (no enrichment, C) in 60 L glass aquaria (40 cm × 40 cm × 40 cm). Immune cell counts, including monocytes and lymphocytes, were significantly lower in enrichment setups compared to the C setup (p < 0.05), whereas spontaneous respiratory burst activity, although higher in enrichment setups, did not differ significantly. Growth and organ weights were unaffected by enrichment, except for a lower hepatosomatic index in VH. No differences in serum markers were detected between setups. In conclusion, the V setup acts as an immunomodulator by reducing immune cell counts in rainbow trout but not affecting its respiratory burst activity. Disease resistance experiments are necessary to determine whether these immune changes affect susceptibility to infections, which is critical for assessing practical implications of V setup in aquaculture and research.

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: Spatially explicit distribution of hedgerows across German agricultural landscapes

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: This dataset contains a spatially explicit estimation of hedgerows across agricultural areas in Germany at 3 m resolution in geotif format. The dataset has been developed as part of the project KlimaFern, Remote Sensing for Improved Climate reporting. Hedgerows here are defined as linear woody features of 3-20 m wide with agriculture on at least one side, akin to the Land Use/Cover Area Survey (LUCAS) criteria. The hedgerow predictions are based on multitemporal PlanetScope imagery for the year 2022 and a convolutional neural network with a UNet backbone. No postprocessing was applied. Details on the calibration and accuracies can be found in Muro et al., (2025) https://doi.org/10.1016/j.rse.2025.114870 . Known limitations of the product are: hedgerows narrower than 3 m in canopy and hedgerows recently coppiced (false negatives) hedgerows close (<~10m) and parallel to other hedgerows or forest patches (false negatives) hedgerows slightly above the 20 m width definition may or may not be included dense tree lines without hedgerows underneath (false positives)

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: Survey-Daten BITS (Baltic International Trawl Survey) - Q4 2023 und Q1 2024

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Der BITS (Baltic International Survey) liefert die wichtigsten fischereiunabhaengigen Daten zum Zustand der Bodenfischarten Dorsch, Flunder, Scholle, Kliesche, Steinbutt und Glattbutt in der Ostsee. Die Reisen werden zweimal jaehrlich im ersten und vierten Quartal durchgefuehrt. Deutschland nimmt an diesen Reisen seit 1981 teil, beprobt seit 1991 mit der FFS „Solea' zweimal jaehrlich die westliche Ostsee mit insgesamt etwa 120 Stationen (2 mal 20 Tage Reisedauer). Daenemark, Schweden, Estland, Lettland, Litauen, Russland, Polen und Deutschland erheben fast zeitgleich auf ihren Schiffen Daten zur Haeufigkeit sowie zu Laenge, Gewicht, und ggfs. Geschlecht, Reife und Gesundheitszustand der Nutzfische. Die Reisen werden durch den Internationalen Rat fuer Meeresforschung (ICES) durch die ICES-Arbeitsgruppe BIFS (Baltic International Survey) koordiniert. Dieser Datensatz enthaelt die Daten aus den 4. Quartal 2023 und 1. Quartal 2024.

The BITS provides the most important fishery-independent information on the status of the demersal fish species Baltic cod, flounder, plaice, dab, turbot and brill in the Baltic Sea. The cruise is conducted twice a year in the first and fourth quarter. Germany has participated in these trips twice a year and 1st and 4th quarter since 1981, since 1991 with the FRV 'Solea', sampling the western Baltic Sea with approximately 120 stations annually (trip duration: 2 x 20 days). On different vessel, Denmark, Sweden, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Russia, Poland and Germany simultaneously collect data on abundance and biological data (e.g. length, weight, sex, maturity and health status) of the commercially important demersal fish species. The cruises are coordinated by the International Council for the Exploration of the Sea (ICES) via the ICES Working Group on Baltic International Fisheries Survey (WGBIFS). This dataset contains the data for Q4 2023 and Q1 2024.

Daenemark, Schweden, Estland, Lettland, Litauen, Russland, Polen und Deutschland erheben fast zeitgleich auf ihren Schiffen Daten zur Haeufigkeit sowie zu Laenge, Gewicht, und ggfs. Geschlecht, Reife und Gesundheitszustand der Nutzfische. Die Reisen werden durch den Internationalen Rat fuer Meeresforschung (ICES) durch die ICES-Arbeitsgruppe BIFS (Baltic International Survey) koordiniert. Dieser Datensatz enthaelt die Daten aus den 4. Quartal 2010 und 1. Quartal 2011.

The BITS provides the most important fishery-independent information on the status of the demersal fish species Baltic cod, flounder, plaice, dab, turbot and brill in the Baltic Sea. The cruise is conducted twice a year in the first and fourth quarter. Germany has participated in these trips twice a year and 1st and 4th quarter since 1981, since 1991 with the FRV 'Solea', sampling the western Baltic Sea with approximately 120 stations annually (trip duration: 2 x 20 days). On different vessel, Denmark, Sweden, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Russia, Poland and Germany simultaneously collect data on abundance and biological data (e.g. length, weight, sex, maturity and health status) of the commercially important demersal fish species. The cruises are coordinated by the International Council for the Exploration of the Sea (ICES) via the ICES Working Group on Baltic International Fisheries Survey (WGBIFS). This dataset contains the data for Q4 2010 and Q1 2011.

citation.title: Agricultural land use (raster): National-scale crop type maps for Germany from combined time series of Sentinel-2 and Landsat data (2025)

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: This preliminary version is based on all available satellite data until August 2025 (*_2025_08). The map will be updated when more data are available. Note: This dataset holds the same information as 10.5281/zenodo.17181503 but with new pyramids for improved visualization. The dataset contains a map of the main classes of agricultural land use (dominant crop types and other land use types) in Germany for the year 2025. It complements a series of maps that are produced annually at the Thuenen Institute beginning with the year 2017 on the basis of satellite data. The maps cover the entire open landscape, i.e., the agriculturally used area (UAA) and e.g., uncultivated areas. Data and methods used to create map versions v301/2 differ from those used in previous versions. The v301/2 maps were derived from a time series of Sentinel-2 and Landsat 8/9 images. Map production is based on the methods described in Pham et al. (2024). All optical satellite data were managed, pre-processed and structured in an analysis-ready data (ARD) cube using the open-source software FORCE - Framework for Operational Radiometric Correction for Environmental monitoring (Frantz, D., 2019), in which SAR and environmental data were integrated. The map extent covers all areas in Germany that are defined as agricultural land, grassland, small woody features, heathland, peatland or unvegetated areas according to ATKIS Basis-DLM (Geobasisdaten: © GeoBasis-DE / BKG, 2020). Version v301: Post-processing of the maps included a sieve filter as well as a ruleset for the reduction of non-plausible areas using the Basis-DLM and the digital terrain model of Germany (Geobasisdaten: © GeoBasis-DE / BKG, 2015). Version v302: Additional post-processing was performed to detect and mask additional non-plausible areas that were not adequately covered by the first post-processing (e.g., areas with sparse vegetation, montane forests) based on the „Oekosystematlas Deutschland' (© Statistisches Bundesamt, Deutschland, 2024). As a consequence, the current version includes a new class 'Small woody features on other land'. Furthermore, the class 'permanent grassland' was refinded. Each pixel that was classified as 'cultivated grassland' in at least five years (between 2017 and 2022) was translated to 'permanent grassland' in the annual maps. Validation: The final maps were validated using all pixels of the publicly available IACS parcels from the federal states of Brandenburg, Lower Saxony, and North Rhine-Westphalia that were not used for model training. Classes that are underrepresented in these federal states could therefore not be adequately evaluated (e.g., hops and grapevines). We provide this dataset 'as is' without any warranty regarding the accuracy or completeness and exclude all liability. The maps are available as cloud optimized GeoTiffs, which makes downloading the full dataset optional. All data can directly be accessed in QGIS, R, Python or any supported software of your choice using the URL that will be provided on request. By doing so the entire map area or only the regions of interest can be accessed. QGIS legend files for data visualization can be downloaded separately. References: Pham, V.-D., Tetteh, G., Thiel, F., Erasmi, S., Schwieder, M., Frantz, D., & van der Linden, S. (2024). Temporally transferable crop mapping with temporal encoding and deep learning augmentations. International Journal of Applied Earth Observation and Geoinformation, 129, 103867. BKG, Bundesamt fuer Kartographie und Geodaesie (2015). Digitales Gelaendemodell Gitterweite 10 m. DGM10. https://sg.geodatenzentrum.de/web_public/gdz/dokumentation/deu/dgm10.pdf (last accessed: 28. April 2022). BKG, Bundesamt fuer Kartographie und Geodaesie (2020). Digitales Basis-Landschaftsmodell. https://sg.geodatenzentrum.de/web_public/gdz/dokumentation/deu/basis-dlm.pdf (last accessed: 28. April 2022). Frantz, D. (2019). FORCE--Landsat + Sentinel-2 Analysis Ready Data and Beyond. Remote Sensing, 11, 1124. Statistisches Bundesamt, Deutschland (2024). Oekosystematlas Deutschland https://oekosystematlas-ugr.destatis.de/ (last accessed: 08.02.2024). ______________________________________________________________________ National-scale crop type maps for Germany from combined time series of Sentinel-1, Sentinel-2 and Landsat data (2024) © 2025 by Tetteh, Gideon Okpoti; Schwieder, Marcel; Blickensdoerfer, Lukas; Gocht, Alexander; Erasmi, Stefan; licensed under CC BY 4.0. Funding was provided by the German Federal Ministry of Food and Agriculture as part of the joint project 'Monitoring der biologischen Vielfalt in Agrarlandschaften' (MonViA, Monitoring of biodiversity in agricultural landscapes).
