citation.title: Dataset: Mass spectrometry of proteins, peptides and small molecules for food authentication - a systematic survey

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Food authenticity is a highly relevant topic for the entire food supply chain from the raw material to the final product. Compliance with raw material specifications and food product related legal requirements (e.g. labelling, marketing) is also mandatory for guarantee food authentication. This is all the more correct if the food is subject to certain restrictions, for example cultural or religious issues. In addition, some manipulations of food also involve health risks. Therefore, the assurance of food authenticity, with the active involvement of all parties involved in the supply chain, has a significant impact on the perception of general legal certainty. This review reports a systematic literature survey based on the topics food authenticity and mass spectrometry in combination with the food groups cereals, fruits, vegetables, mushrooms, beans, edible oils, spices, herbs, meat, seafood, milk, egg, honey, insects. Special attention was paid to the demands of the official food control authorities, concerning method development and validation aspects, as well as the improvement of data evaluation. The review shows a great need for fully validated, routine-capable and standardized methods as well as for the development of food data systems using artificial intelligence where reasonable to prevent food authenticity crises in future.

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: Calculations of gaseous and particulate emissions from German agriculture 1990 - 2022: Input data and emission results

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: In international conventions Germany has committed to the mitigation of emissions of greenhouse gases and air pollution. These international regulations (protocols etc.) are the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC), the UNECE Convention on Long-Range Transboundary Air Pollution (CLRTAP), and within the European Union the Directive of the European Parliament and of the Council on national emission ceilings for certain atmospheric pollutants (NEC Directive). These conventions require annual calculations of the emissions of the respective gases and air pollutants. The results have to be documented in an emission inventory and to be reported to the organisations in charge. The data file contains input data and results of the calculation of gas and particulate emissions from German agriculture for Germany and the federal states in the years 1990 - 2022. In this context the sector Agriculture comprises the emissions from animal husbandry, the use of agricultural soils and anaerobic digestion of energy crops. As required by the guidelines, emissions from activities preceding agriculture, from the use of energy and from land use change are reported elsewhere in the national inventories.

Deutschland hat sich auf internationaler Ebene zur Minderung von Emissionen von Treibhausgasen und luftverschmutzenden Stoffen verpflichtet. Hierbei handelt es sich um die Klimarahmenkonvention (UN Framework Convention on Climate Change, UNFCCC), die Konvention zur Verminderung und Vermeidung grenzueberschreitender Luftverunreinigungen (UNECE Convention on Long-Range Transboundary Air Pollution, CLRTAP) sowie in der Europaeischen Union um die Festlegung von Emissionsobergrenzen fuer einige Stoffe, u. a. Ammoniak (NEC-Richtlinie). Im Rahmen dieser Abkommen muessen die nationalen Emissionen der entsprechenden Gase und Luftschadstoffe jaehrlich berechnet und in Form des Emissionsinventars an die zustaendigen Organisationen uebermittelt werden. Die Datendatei beinhaltet Inputdaten und Ergebnisse der Berechnung von gas- und partikelfoermigen Emissionen aus der deutschen Landwirtschaft fuer Deutschland und die Bundeslaender in den Jahren 1990 - 2022. Der Bereich Landwirtschaft umfasst dabei die Emissionen aus der Tierhaltung und der Nutzung landwirtschaftlicher Boeden sowie aus der Vergaerung von Energiepflanzen. Emissionen aus dem Vorleistungsbereich, aus der Nutzung von Energie sowie Landnutzungsaenderungen werden den Regelwerken entsprechend an anderer Stelle in den nationalen Inventaren berichtet.

citation.title: Evidence of hybridization betweenn genetically distinct Baltic cod stocks during peak population abundance - historical

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Range expansions can lead to increased contact of divergent populations, thus increasing the potential of hybridization events. Whether viable hybrids are produced will most likely depend on the level of genomic divergence and associated genomic incompatibilities between the different entities as well as environmental conditions. By taking advantage of historical Baltic cod (Gadus morhua) otolith samples combined with genotyping and whole genome sequencing, we here investigate the genetic impact of the increased spawning stock biomass of the eastern Baltic cod stock in the mid 1980s. The eastern Baltic cod is genetically highly differentiated from the adjacent western Baltic cod, and locally adapted to the brackish environmental conditions in the deeper Eastern basins of the Baltic Sea unsuitable for its marine counterparts. Our genotyping results show an increased proportion of eastern Baltic cod in western Baltic areas (Mecklenburg Bay and Arkona Basin) - indicative of a range expansion westwards - during the peak population abundance in the 1980s. Additionally, we detect high frequencies of potential hybrids (including F1, F2 and backcrosses), verified by whole genome sequencing data for a subset of individuals. Analysis of mitochondrial genomes further indicates directional gene flow from eastern Baltic cod males to western Baltic cod females. Our findings unravel that increased overlap in distribution can promote hybridization between highly divergent populations, and that the hybrids can be viable and survive under specific and favourable environmental conditions. However, the observed hybridization had seemingly no long-lasting impact on the continuous separation and genetic differentiation between the unique Baltic cod stocks.

Ausdehnungen des Verbreitungsgebiets koennen zu einem verstaerkten Kontakt zwischen unterschiedlichen Populationen fuehren und damit das Potenzial fuer Hybridisierungsereignisse erhoehen. Ob lebensfaehige Hybriden entstehen, haengt hoechstwahrscheinlich vom Grad der genomischen Divergenz und den damit verbundenen genomischen Inkompatibilitaeten zwischen den verschiedenen Einheiten sowie von den Umweltbedingungen ab. Anhand historischer Otolithenproben des Ostseedorsches (Gadus morhua) in Kombination mit Genotypisierung und Ganzgenomsequenzierung untersuchen wir hier die genetischen Auswirkungen des Anstiegs der Biomasse des oestlichen Ostseedorsches als Laichfisch Mitte der 1980er Jahre. Der oestliche Ostseedorsch unterscheidet sich genetisch stark vom benachbarten westlichen Ostseedorsch und ist lokal an die brackigen Umweltbedingungen in den tieferen oestlichen Becken der Ostsee angepasst, die fuer seine marinen Gegenstuecke ungeeignet sind. Unsere Genotypisierungsergebnisse zeigen, dass der Anteil des oestlichen Ostseedorsches in den westlichen Ostseegebieten (Mecklenburger Bucht und Arkonabecken) waehrend des Hoehepunkts der Populationsdichte in den 1980er Jahren gestiegen ist, was auf eine Ausdehnung des Verbreitungsgebiets nach Westen hinweist. Ausserdem stellen wir eine hohe Haeufigkeit potenzieller Hybriden (einschliesslich F1, F2 und Rueckkreuzungen) fest, was durch Ganzgenomsequenzierungsdaten fuer eine Untergruppe von Individuen bestaetigt wird. Die Analyse der mitochondrialen Genome zeigt ausserdem, dass der Genfluss von maennlichen Dorschen der oestlichen Ostsee zu weiblichen Dorschen der westlichen Ostsee gerichtet ist. Unsere Ergebnisse zeigen, dass eine zunehmende Ueberlappung der Verbreitungsgebiete die Hybridisierung zwischen stark voneinander abweichenden Populationen foerdern kann und dass die Hybriden unter bestimmten, guenstigen Umweltbedingungen lebensfaehig sein und ueberleben koennen. Die beobachtete Hybridisierung hatte jedoch scheinbar keine dauerhaften Auswirkungen auf die kontinuierliche Trennung und genetische Differenzierung zwischen den einzelnen Dorschbestaenden der Ostsee.

citation.title: Agricultural land use (raster) : National-scale crop type maps for Germany from combined time series of Sentinel-1, Sentinel-2 and Landsat data (2017 to 2021)

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: The dataset contains maps of the main classes of agricultural land use (dominant crop types and other land use types) in Germany, which have been produced annually at the Thuenen Institute since 2017 on the basis of satellite data. The maps cover the entire open landscape, i.e. the agriculturally used area (UAA) and e.g. uncultivated areas. The map was derived from time series of Sentinel-1, Sentinel-2, Landsat 8 and additional environmental data. Map production is based on the methods described in Blickensdoerfer et al. (2022). The map extent covers all areas in Germany that are defined as agricultural land, small woody features, heathland or peatland according to ATKIS Basis-DLM 2020 (Geobasisdaten: © GeoBasis-DE / BKG (2020)). Post-processing of the maps included a sieve filter as well as a ruleset for the reduction of non-plausible areas using the Basis-DLM. The final post-processing step comprises the aggregation of the gridded data to homogeneous objects (fields) based on the approach that is described in Tetteh et al. (2021). Data are available either in gridded (raster) format or in aggregated (vector) format.

Der Datensatz enthaelt Karten der wichtigsten landwirtschaftlichen Nutzungsklassen (vorherrschende Kulturarten und andere Landnutzungstypen) in Deutschland, die seit 2017 jaehrlich am Thuenen-Institut auf Basis von Satellitendaten erstellt werden. Die Karten umfassen die gesamte offene Landschaft, d.h. die landwirtschaftlich genutzte Flaeche (LF) und z.B. die nicht bewirtschafteten Flaechen des Offenlands. Die Karte wurde aus dichten Zeitreihen von Sentinel-1, Sentinel-2, Landsat 8 und zusaetzlichen Umweltdaten abgeleitet. Die Kartenerstellung basiert auf den in Blickensdoerfer et al. (2022) beschriebenen Methoden. Die Karten umfassen alle Flaechen in Deutschland, die nach ATKIS Basis-DLM 2020 (Geobasisdaten: © GeoBasis-DE / BKG (2020)) als landwirtschaftliche Flaechen, Kleingehoelze, Heideflaechen oder Moorflaechen definiert sind. Die Nachbearbeitung der Karten umfasste eine Filterung sowie ein Regelwerk zur Reduktion von unplausiblen Flaechen unter Verwendung des Basis-DLM. Der letzte Nachbearbeitungsschritt umfasst die Aggregation der gerasterten Daten zu homogenen Objekten (Feldern), die nach dem in Tetteh et al. (2021) beschriebenen Ansatz erstellt wurden. Die Daten sind entweder im Rasterformat oder im Vektorformat verfuegbar.

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: Agricultural land use (raster) : National-scale crop type maps for Germany from combined time series of Sentinel-1, Sentinel-2 and Landsat data (2022)

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: The dataset contains a map of the main classes of agricultural land use (dominant crop types and other land use types) in Germany for the year 2022. It complements a series of maps that are produced annually at the Thuenen Institute beginning with the year 2017 on the basis of satellite data. The maps cover the entire open landscape, i.e., the agriculturally used area (UAA) and e.g., uncultivated areas. The map was derived from time series of Sentinel-1, Sentinel-2, Landsat 8 and additional environmental data. Map production is based on the methods described in Blickensdoerfer et al. (2022). All optical satellite data were managed, pre-processed and structured in an analysis-ready data (ARD) cube using the open-source software FORCE - Framework for Operational Radiometric Correction for Environmental monitoring (Frantz, D., 2019), in which SAR and environmental data were integrated. The map extent covers all areas in Germany that are defined as agricultural land, grassland, small woody features, heathland, peatland or unvegetated areas according to ATKIS Basis-DLM (Geobasisdaten: © GeoBasis-DE / BKG, 2020). Version v201: Post-processing of the maps included a sieve filter as well as a ruleset for the reduction of non-plausible areas using the Basis-DLM and the digital terrain model of Germany (Geobasisdaten: © GeoBasis-DE / BKG, 2015). Version v202: Additional post-processing was performed to detect and mask additional non-plausible areas that were not adequately covered by the first post-processing (e.g., areas with sparse vegetation, montane forests) based on the „Oekosystematlas Deutschland' (© Statistisches Bundesamt, Deutschland, 2024). As a consequence, the current version includes a new class 'Small woody features on other land'. Furthermore, the class 'permanent grassland' was refinded. Each pixel that was classified as 'cultivated grassland' in at least five years (between 2017 and 2022) was translated to 'permanent grassland' in the annual maps. The maps are available as cloud optimized GeoTiffs, which makes downloading the full dataset optional. All data can directly be accessed in QGIS, R, Python or any supported software of your choice using the URL that will be provided on request. By doing so the entire map area or only the regions of interest can be accessed. QGIS legend files for data visualization can be downloaded separately. Class-specific accuracies for each year are proveded in the respective tables. We provide this dataset 'as is' without any warranty regarding the accuracy or completeness and exclude all liability. References: Blickensdoerfer, L., Schwieder, M., Pflugmacher, D., Nendel, C., Erasmi, S., & Hostert, P. (2022). Mapping of crop types and crop sequences with combined time series of Sentinel-1, Sentinel-2 and Landsat 8 data for Germany. Remote Sensing of Environment, 269, 112831. BKG, Bundesamt fuer Kartographie und Geodaesie (2015). Digitales Gelaendemodell Gitterweite 10 m. DGM10. https://sg.geodatenzentrum.de/web_public/gdz/dokumentation/deu/dgm10.pdf (last accessed: 28. April 2022). BKG, Bundesamt fuer Kartographie und Geodaesie (2020). Digitales Basis-Landschaftsmodell. https://sg.geodatenzentrum.de/web_public/gdz/dokumentation/deu/basis-dlm.pdf (last accessed: 28. April 2022). Frantz, D. (2019). FORCE--Landsat + Sentinel-2 Analysis Ready Data and Beyond. Remote Sensing, 11, 1124. Statistisches Bundesamt, Deutschland (2024). Oekosystematlas Deutschland https://oekosystematlas-ugr.destatis.de/ (last accessed: 08.02.2024).

The map was derived from time series of Sentinel-1, Sentinel-2, Landsat 8 and additional environmental data. Map production is based on the methods described in Blickensdoerfer et al. (2022). All optical satellite data were managed, pre-processed and structured in an analysis-ready data (ARD) cube using the open-source software FORCE - Framework for Operational Radiometric Correction for Environmental monitoring (Frantz, D., 2019), in which SAR and environmental data were integrated. The map extent covers all areas in Germany that are defined as agricultural land, grassland, small woody features, heathland, peatland or unvegetated areas according to ATKIS Basis-DLM (Geobasisdaten: © GeoBasis-DE / BKG, 2020). Version v201: Post-processing of the maps included a sieve filter as well as a ruleset for the reduction of non-plausible areas using the Basis-DLM and the digital terrain model of Germany (Geobasisdaten: © GeoBasis-DE / BKG, 2015). Version v202: Additional post-processing was performed to detect and mask additional non-plausible areas that were not adequately covered by the first post-processing (e.g., areas with sparse vegetation, montane forests) based on the „Oekosystematlas Deutschland' (© Statistisches Bundesamt, Deutschland, 2024). As a consequence, the current version includes a new class 'Small woody features on other land'. Furthermore, the class 'permanent grassland' was refinded. Each pixel that was classified as 'cultivated grassland' in at least five years (between 2017 and 2022) was translated to 'permanent grassland' in the annual maps. The maps are available as cloud optimized GeoTiffs, which makes downloading the full dataset optional. All data can directly be accessed in QGIS, R, Python or any supported software of your choice using the URL that will be provided on request. By doing so the entire map area or only the regions of interest can be accessed. QGIS legend files for data visualization can be downloaded separately. Class-specific accuracies for each year are proveded in the respective tables. We provide this dataset 'as is' without any warranty regarding the accuracy or completeness and exclude all liability. subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: Dataset for the Comprehensive Characterization of Plant-Based Drinks: Vitamins and Selected Secondary Plant Metabolites

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: This subset of data provides detailed information on vitamins as well as some selected secondary plant metabolites, namely phytosterols, phytates and isoflavones. This dataset was created as part of a project aimed to comprehensively characterize the composition of plant-based drinks, with a focus on oat, soy, and almond drinks. In total, six samples from each beverage category were analyzed in duplicate batches. Further details on the experimental setup, sample collection, and applied methodologies can be found in the linked publication on this page. These data are intended to serve the scientific community as a basis for evaluating these products and are also available for consumption studies analysis.

citation.title: Agricultural land use (vector) : National-scale crop type maps for Germany from combined time series of Sentinel-1, Sentinel-2 and Landsat data (2017 to 2021)

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: The dataset contains maps of the main classes of agricultural land use (dominant crop types and other land use types) in Germany, which have been produced annually at the Thuenen Institute since 2017 on the basis of satellite data. The maps cover the entire open landscape, i.e. the agriculturally used area (UAA) and e.g. uncultivated areas. The map was derived from time series of Sentinel-1, Sentinel-2, Landsat 8 and additional environmental data. Map production is based on the methods described in Blickensdoerfer et al. (2022). All optical satellite data were managed, pre-processed and structured in an analysis-ready data (ARD) cube using the open-source software FORCE - Framework for Operational Radiometric Correction for Environmental monitoring (Frantz, D., 2019), in which SAR and environmental data were integrated. The map extent covers all areas in Germany that are defined as agricultural land, small woody features, heathland or peatland according to ATKIS Basis-DLM 2020 (Geobasisdaten: © GeoBasis-DE / BKG (2020)). Post-processing of the maps included a sieve filter as well as a ruleset for the reduction of non-plausible areas using the Basis-DLM. The final post-processing step comprises the aggregation of the gridded data to homogeneous objects (fields) based on the approach that is described in Tetteh et al. (2021). Data are available either in gridded (raster) format or in aggregated (vector) format.

Der Datensatz enthaelt Karten der wichtigsten landwirtschaftlichen Nutzungsklassen (vorherrschende Kulturarten und andere Landnutzungstypen) in Deutschland, die seit 2017 jaehrlich am Thuenen-Institut auf Basis von Satellitendaten erstellt werden. Die Karten umfassen die gesamte offene Landschaft, d.h. die landwirtschaftlich genutzte Flaeche (LF) und z.B. die nicht bewirtschafteten Flaechen des Offenlands. Die Karte wurde aus dichten Zeitreihen von Sentinel-1, Sentinel-2, Landsat 8 und zusaetzlichen Umweltdaten abgeleitet. Die Kartenerstellung basiert auf den in Blickensdoerfer et al. (2022) beschriebenen Methoden. Die Karten umfassen alle Flaechen in Deutschland, die nach ATKIS Basis-DLM 2020 (Geobasisdaten: © GeoBasis-DE / BKG (2020)) als landwirtschaftliche Flaechen, Kleingehoelze, Heideflaechen oder Moorflaechen definiert sind. Die Nachbearbeitung der Karten umfasste eine Filterung sowie ein Regelwerk zur Reduktion von unplausiblen Flaechen unter Verwendung des Basis-DLM. Der letzte Nachbearbeitungsschritt umfasst die Aggregation der gerasterten Daten zu homogenen Objekten (Feldern), die nach dem in Tetteh et al. (2021) beschriebenen Ansatz erstellt wurden. Die Daten sind entweder im Rasterformat oder im Vektorformat verfuegbar.

citation.title: Dataset: Tabellenanhang Handbuch N-Gesamtbilanz Bilanzjahr 2019, Handbuch, 2. ueberarbeitete Fassung

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Der vorliegende Datensatz beinhaltet Werte fuer alle Bilanzglieder der Nationalen Stickstoff-Gesamtbilanz von 1990 bis 2019. Der Datensatz ist komplementaer zum Handbuch zur Berechnung der Nationalen Stickstoff-Bilanz (Mueller et al., 2024, Berechnung der Stickstoff-Bilanz fuer die Landwirtschaft in Deutschland - Jahre 1990 bis 2019, 2. Fassung, in: Berichte aus dem Julius Kuehn-Institut, Julius Kuehn-Institut, Bundesforschungsinstitut fuer Kulturpflanzen, Quedlinburg, Deutschland.). Die zugefuehrten und abgefuehrten Stickstoffmengen in den einzelnen Positionen werden gegeneinander verrechnet und auf die landwirtschaftlich genutzte Flaeche Deutschlands bezogen. Somit ergibt sich ein Stickstoff-Saldo je Hektar fuer Deutschland im entsprechenden Bilanzjahr.

The presented dataset comprises values for all items which make up the National-Nitrogen-Balance from 1990 to 2019. The dataset is complementary to the handbook for the calculation of the National-Nitrogen-Balance (Mueller et al., 2024, Berechnung der Stickstoff-Bilanz fuer die Landwirtschaft in Deutschland - Jahre 1990 bis 2019, 2. Fassung, in: Berichte aus dem Julius Kuehn-Institut, Julius Kuehn-Institut, Bundesforschungsinstitut fuer Kulturpflanzen, Quedlinburg, Germany.). Nitrogen inputs and outputs are set off against each other and divided by the area used for agriculture in Germany resulting in a Nitrogen-balance per hectare.

citation.title: Grassland mowing events across Germany detected from combined Sentinel-2 and Landsat time series for the year 2022

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Grasslands provide a wide range of important ecosystem services. Mapping and assessing the status and use intensity of grasslands is thus important for environmental monitoring. We here provide maps with detected mowing events, as a proxy for grassland use intensity, for grassland areas across Germany for the year 2022. The dataset contains maps of grassland mowing activity in Germany, which have been produced annually at the Thuenen Institute beginning with the year 2017 on the basis of satellite data. The maps cover the entire grassland area, i.e. permanent grassland, potentially permanent grassland (e.g. fodder crops) and other extensive areas. They are derived from dense time series of Sentinel-2, Landsat 8 (and 9) data. Map production is based on the methods described in Schwieder et al. (2022). The algorithm used to derive the maps is available as a user-defined function for the FORCE environment (Frantz, D., 2019). The dataset includes seven layers: (1) the number of detected mowing events, (2) the day of year (DOY) of the first to sixth detected mowing event. Ancillary data layers are available on request. The maps include all areas that have at least once been classified as permanent grassland, cultivated grassland or fallow in the maps of agricultural land use between 2017 and 2021 that are provided by Thuenen Institute. Please consider to use the respective annual agricultural land use map or any other data source to generate a mask for your purpose. We provide this dataset 'as is' without any warranty regarding the quality or completeness and exclude all liability. Please refer to Schwieder et al. (2022) for the related accuracy assessment and potential limitations and / or contact the authors directly. The maps are available as cloud optimized GeoTiffs, which makes downloading the full dataset optional. All data can directly be accessed in QGIS, R, Python or any supported software of your choice using the URL to the datasets that will be provided on request. By doing so the entire map area or only the regions of interest can be accessed. References Frantz, D. (2019). FORCE--Landsat + Sentinel-2 Analysis Ready Data and Beyond. Remote Sensing, 11, 1124. Schwieder, M., Wesemeyer, M., Frantz, D., Pfoch, K., Erasmi, S., Pickert, J., Nendel, C., & Hostert, P. (2022). Mapping grassland mowing events across Germany based on combined Sentinel-2 and Landsat 8 time series. Remote Sensing of Environment, 269, 112795.

citation.title: Agricultural land use (vector) : National-scale crop type maps for Germany from combined time series of Sentinel-1, Sentinel-2 and Landsat data (2023)

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: The dataset contains a map of the main classes of agricultural land use (dominant crop types and other land use types) in Germany for the year 2023. It complements a series of maps that are produced annually at the Thuenen Institute beginning in 2017 on the basis of satellite data. The maps cover the entire open landscape, i.e., the agriculturally used area (UAA) and, e.g., uncultivated areas. The generation of the maps involved four steps. Firstly, a raster map was derived from a time series of Sentinel-1, Sentinel-2, Landsat 8, and additional environmental data following the approach of Blickensdoerfer et al. (2022). Secondly, agricultural field boundaries were generated based on monthly composites of Sentinel-2 and Landsat 8/9 images using the approach of Waldner et al. (2021). Thirdly, the agricultural fields were spatially overlaid on the raster map, and the class per field was assigned via majority voting. Finally, all the fields were simplified to remove redundant vertices while preserving essential shape. All optical satellite data were managed, pre-processed and structured in an analysis-ready data (ARD) cube using the open-source software FORCE - Framework for Operational Radiometric Correction for Environmental monitoring (Frantz, D., 2019), in which SAR and environmental data were integrated. The map extent covers all areas in Germany that are defined as agricultural land, grassland, small woody features, heathland, peatland or unvegetated areas according to ATKIS Basis-DLM (Geobasisdaten: © GeoBasis-DE / BKG, 2020). Version v201: Post-processing of the maps included a sieve filter as well as a ruleset for the reduction of non-plausible areas using the Basis-DLM and the digital terrain model of Germany (Geobasisdaten: © GeoBasis-DE / BKG, 2015). The maps are available in FlatGeobuf format, which makes downloading the full dataset optional. All data can directly be accessed in QGIS, R, Python or any supported software of your choice using the URL to the datasets that will be provided on request. By doing so the entire map area or only the regions of interest can be accessed. QGIS legend files for data visualization can be downloaded separately. Class-specific accuracies for each year are proveded in the respective tables. We provide this dataset 'as is' without any warranty regarding the accuracy or completeness and exclude all liability. citation.title: Data set: blank values from heubach dustmeter-testing sugar beets, version 2 (correction)

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: This is a correction of https://doi.org/10.5073/20231122-114346-0 published as version 2. In the datasheet Data-LOD-LOQ-ZR (3) the Weight delta for Lab C, Employee B, Seed Lot 1, Number of measurement 8 had to be corrected (see in the datasheet, test 2, Column H, Line 110) correct is -0,00006 (former value: 0,00006). In the datasheet Data-LOD-LOQ-ZR (3) the Weight delta for Lab C, Employee B, Seed Lot 2, Number of measurement 9 had to be corrected (see in the datasheet, test 2, Column H, Line 121) correct is 0,00005 (former value: 3,00005). With the Heubach method free floating dust of treated seeds can be measured. The Heubach value is used as an indicator for seed quality. One way to make the heubach results more reliable can be the definition of LOD and LOQ. Blank measurements were conducted in several heubach labs for this data collection to allow a calculation of LOD (limit of detection) and LOQ (limit of quantification) for the Heubach method. Three Tests (Data_LOD_LOQ_ZR.xlsx) were performed following the EU-Code of Practise for the monitoring of floating dust of treated seeds (Version 05.1, published by the Seed Treatment Stewardship Steering Committee (STICCS Group) on 1st August 2021). The material and methods used are described in Material_and_Method.pdf and the procedure for estimation of LOD and LOQ for Heubach seed abrasion dust method is described in Procedure_for_the_estimation_of_LOD_and_LOQ_sugar_beets.pdf.

citation.title: Agricultural land use (raster) : National-scale crop type maps for Germany from combined time series of Sentinel-1, Sentinel-2 and Landsat data (2024)

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: The dataset contains a map of the main classes of agricultural land use (dominant crop types and other land use types) in Germany for the year 2024. It complements a series of maps that are produced annually at the Thuenen Institute beginning with the year 2017 on the basis of satellite data. The maps cover the entire open landscape, i.e., the agriculturally used area (UAA) and e.g., uncultivated areas. The data and methods used to create this map differ from those used in previous versions. The map was derived from a time series of Sentinel-2 and Landsat 8/9 images. Map production is based on the methods described in Pham et al. (2024). All optical satellite data were managed, pre-processed and structured in an analysis-ready data (ARD) cube using the open-source software FORCE - Framework for Operational Radiometric Correction for Environmental monitoring (Frantz, D., 2019), in which SAR and environmental data were integrated. The map extent covers all areas in Germany that are defined as agricultural land, grassland, small woody features, heathland, peatland or unvegetated areas according to ATKIS Basis-DLM (Geobasisdaten: © GeoBasis-DE / BKG, 2020). Version v201: Post-processing of the maps included a sieve filter as well as a ruleset for the reduction of non-plausible areas using the Basis-DLM and the digital terrain model of Germany (Geobasisdaten: © GeoBasis-DE / BKG, 2015). Version v202: Additional post-processing was performed to detect and mask additional non-plausible areas that were not adequately covered by the first post-processing (e.g., areas with sparse vegetation, montane forests) based on the „Oekosystematlas Deutschland' (© Statistisches Bundesamt, Deutschland, 2024). As a consequence, the current version includes a new class 'Small woody features on other land'. Furthermore, the class 'permanent grassland' was refinded. Each pixel that was classified as 'cultivated grassland' in at least five years (between 2017 and 2022) was translated to 'permanent grassland' in the annual maps. The maps are available as cloud optimized GeoTiffs, which makes downloading the full dataset optional. All data can directly be accessed in QGIS, R, Python or any supported software of your choice using the URL that will be provided on request. By doing so the entire map area or only the regions of interest can be accessed. QGIS legend files for data visualization can be downloaded separately. Class-specific accuracies for each year are proveded in the respective tables. We provide this dataset 'as is' without any warranty regarding the accuracy or completeness and exclude all liability. References: Pham, V.-D., Tetteh, G., Thiel, F., Erasmi, S., Schwieder, M., Frantz, D., & van der Linden, S. (2024). Temporally transferable crop mapping with temporal encoding and deep learning augmentations. International Journal of Applied Earth Observation and Geoinformation, 129, 103867. BKG, Bundesamt fuer Kartographie und Geodaesie (2015). Digitales Gelaendemodell Gitterweite 10 m. DGM10. https://sg.geodatenzentrum.de/web_public/gdz/dokumentation/deu/dgm10.pdf (last accessed: 28. April 2022). BKG, Bundesamt fuer Kartographie und Geodaesie (2020). Digitales Basis-Landschaftsmodell. https://sg.geodatenzentrum.de/web_public/gdz/dokumentation/deu/basis-dlm.pdf (last accessed: 28. April 2022). Frantz, D. (2019). FORCE--Landsat + Sentinel-2 Analysis Ready Data and Beyond. Remote Sensing, 11, 1124. Statistisches Bundesamt, Deutschland (2024). Oekosystematlas Deutschland https://oekosystematlas-ugr.destatis.de/ (last accessed: 08.02.2024). ___________________________________________________________________________ National-scale crop type maps for Germany from combined time series of Sentinel-1, Sentinel-2 and Landsat data (2024) © 2025 by Tetteh, Gideon Okpoti; Schwieder, Marcel; Blickensdoerfer, Lukas; Gocht, Alexander; Erasmi, Stefan; licensed under CC BY 4.0. Funding was provided by the German Federal Ministry of Food and Agriculture as part of the joint project 'Monitoring der biologischen Vielfalt in Agrarlandschaften' (MonViA, Monitoring of biodiversity in agricultural landscapes).

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: PAH-Metaboliten in Fischen aus der Nord- und Ostsee (2022)

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Polyaromatische Kohlenwasserstoffe (PAH) sind Bestandteil fossiler Energietraeger und haben natuerliche und anthropogene Quellen. Man findet sie in der Umwelt zum Beispiel in der Naehe von Haefen oder Schifffahrtsrouten. Zur Gruppe der PAH gehoeren auch krebserregende Substanzen. Fische metabolisieren PAH sehr schnell, so dass PAH selbst in Fischen kaum nachweisbar sind, wohl aber ihre Metaboliten in der Galle des Fisches. Die Gehalte von PAK-Metaboliten in Meeresfisch werden im Rahmen des Umwelt-Monitorings des Thuenen-Instituts fuer Fischereioekologie regelmaessig ueberwacht, um die Hoehe der PAK-Belastung indirekt zu erfassen und zu bewerten sowie regionale und zeitliche Unterschiede in dieser Belastung festzustellen. Die Ergebnisse fliessen in nationale und europaeische Umweltbewertungen ein. Die Daten sind Teil des Monitorings im Thuenen-Institut fuer Fischereioekologie und sind als solche ueber die ICES-Datenbank Dome oeffentlich zugaenglich. Erlaeuterungen zu den ICES Codes in der angehaengten Datei findet man hier: https://www.ices.dk/data/vocabularies/Pages/default.aspx

citation.title: Referenzdaten aus dem Projekt FNEWS

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Der Datensatz wurde im Projekt „Fernerkundungsbasiertes Nationales Erfassungssystem Waldschaeden (FNEWS)' zum Training und zur Optimierung eines Verfahrens zur automatisierten Erfassung von Waldschaeden hergestellt und verwendet. Die Veroeffentlichung des umfangreichen Referenzdatensatzes leistet damit einen Beitrag zur Unterstuetzung der Wissenschaft und Forschung im Bereich des fernerkundungsbasierten Waldmonitorings. Der bereitgestellte Geodatensatz „referenzdaten_fnews_3_0.gpkg' besteht aus georeferenzierten Polygonen von Waldschaeden (und ungeschaedigten Referenzflaechen) aus den Untersuchungsgebieten des Projektes FNEWS (fnews-wald.de). Der Datensatz umfasst detaillierte Zusatzinformationen ueber Schaedigung und Waldstruktur. Die erfassten Waldschaeden liegen im Zeitraum von 2018 bis 2021. Der Datensatz wurde im Projekt FNEWS in Zusammenarbeit der Partner Nordwestdeutsche Forstliche Versuchsanstalt (NW-FVA), Forstliche Versuchs- und Forschungsanstalt Baden-Wuerttemberg (FVA-BW), Bayerische Landesanstalt fuer Wald und Forstwirtschaft (LWF), Staatsbetrieb Sachsenforst (SBS) und dem Thuenen-Institut fuer Waldoekosysteme (TI-WO) produziert. Der Geodatensatz wird ueber die Plattform des Thuenen-Waldatlasses und OpenAgrar im Rahmen einer CC-BY 4.0 Lizenz publiziert. Die Bereitstellung erfolgt per OGC Compliance Dienst (WMS) und als lokaler Download. Der lokale Download wird ueber die Plattform OpenAgrar angeboten. Der Geodatensatz liegt im Koordinatensystem WGS 84 / UTM Zone 32N (EPSG: 32632) vor und umfasst 16.300 Polygone aus den Untersuchungsgebieten der Bundeslandpartner. Als Zusatzinformationen werden neun Attribute pro Polygon bereitgestellt. Die Attribute wurden von forstlichen Experten aus den Bundeslaendern auf Basis unterschiedlicher Sachdaten definiert. Attribute, die nicht eindeutig bestimmt werden konnten, tragen einen Leerwert. Fuer den Datenzugang und weitere Informationen wenden Sie sich bitte an fnews@thuenen.de. Die Datenquelle ist wie folgt anzugeben: Daten des Staatsbetrieb Sachsenforst. Darstellung auf Grundlage der Digitalen Referenzdaten Landeswald vom FNEWS-Projekt mit Genehmigung des Staatsbetriebes Sachsenforst 2023, Zeitraum von 2018 bis 2021. Daten der Forstliche Versuchsanstalt Baden-Wuerttemberg. Datengrundlage: Referenzdaten aus FNEWS-Projekt, Zeitraum 2018 bis 2021. Forstliche Versuch- und Forschungsanstalt Baden-Wuerttemberg (www.fva-bw.de). Daten der Nordwestdeutschen Forstlichen Versuchsanstalt. Referenzdaten im Untersuchungsgebiet 32UNC erfasst und bereitgestellt durch die Nordwestdeutsche Forstliche Versuchsanstalt (2023). Die Wiedergabevermerke muessen gut lesbar in der Bildunterschrift oder Kartenlegende, sowie bei Zitaten im Text platziert werden. Koordinatensystem: EPSG:32632 Type of Resource: Vektor/ Geopackage

The data set was produced and used in the project 'Remote sensing-based National Forest Damage Assessment System (FNEWS)' to train and optimise a method for automated forest damage assessment. The publication of the detailed reference dataset thus contributes to the support of science and research in the field of remote sensing-based forest monitoring. The geodata provided, 'referenzdaten_fnews_3_0.gpkg', consists of georeferenced polygons of forest damage (and undamaged reference areas) from the research areas of the FNEWS project (fnews-wald.de). The data set contains detailed additional information on damage and forest structure. The recorded forest damage covers the period from 2018 to 2021. The dataset was produced in the FNEWS project in cooperation with the partners Nordwestdeutsche Forstliche Versuchsanstalt (NW-FVA), Forstliche Versuchs- und Forschungsanstalt Baden-Wuerttemberg (FVA-BW), Bayerische Landesanstalt fuer Wald und Forstwirtschaft (LWF), Staatsbetrieb Sachsenforst (SBS) and the Thuenen Institute for Forest Ecosystems (TI-WO). The geodata set is published via the platform of the Thuenen Forest Atlas and OpenAgrar under a CC-BY 4.0 licence. It is accessible via OGC Compliance Service (WMS) and as a local download. The local download is offered via the OpenAgrar platform. The geodata set is available as WGS 84 / UTM Zone 32N coordinate system (EPSG: 32632) and comprises 16,300 polygons from the study areas of the federal state partners. As additional information, nine attributes per polygon are provided. The attributes were interpreted and defined by forestry experts from the federal states on the basis of different types of data. Attributes that could not be clearly determined have a NoData value. For data access and further information, please contact fnews@thuenen.de. The data source must be indicated as follows: Daten des Staatsbetrieb Sachsenforst. Darstellung auf Grundlage der Digitalen Referenzdaten Landeswald vom FNEWS-Projekt mit Genehmigung des Staatsbetriebes Sachsenforst 2023, Zeitraum von 2018 bis 2021. Daten der Forstliche Versuchsanstalt Baden-Wuerttemberg. Datengrundlage: Referenzdaten aus FNEWS-Projekt, Zeitraum 2018 bis 2021. Forstliche Versuch- und Forschungsanstalt Baden-Wuerttemberg (www.fva-bw.de). Daten der Nordwestdeutschen Forstlichen Versuchsanstalt. Referenzdaten im Untersuchungsgebiet 32UNC erfasst und bereitgestellt durch die Nordwestdeutsche Forstliche Versuchsanstalt (2023). The caption or map legend must be clearly legible, as must the text in the case of quotations. Koordinatensystem: EPSG:32632 Type of Resource: Vector/ Geopackage

citation.title: Mouse Lockboxes - 3D printing files and videos

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: This repository contains 3D printable STL files for the mouse lockboxes (LB) and videos of mice solving the lockboxes. Lockboxes are mechanical puzzles consisting of one or more steps, which are baited with a food reward. The mice manipulate the lockboxes on a voluntary basis.

citation.title: Dataset to Schiedung et al. (2025): Separating fast from slow cycling soil organic carbon - A multi-method comparison on land use change sites

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: This is the data used in the manuscript: Schiedung, M., Barré, P., & Peoplau, C. (2025). Separating fast from slow cycling soil organic carbon - A multi-method comparison on land use change sites. Geoderma, 453, 117154. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.geoderma.2024.117154 The repository includes the following files: dat_LUC.csv: All data presented in the manuscript for the particle size fractionation, Rock-Eval analysis and extracted DIRFT-MIR spectra information Var_names_dat_LUC.csv: Description of all variables and parameters in dat_LUC.csv and corresponding units spc_bulk_rs.csv: Resampled DRIFT-MIR spetra in the range of 455-3999 1/cm of all bulk soils with IDs presented in Var_names_dat_LUC.csv. spc_fractions_rs.csv: Resampled DRIFT-MIR spetra in the range of 455-3999 1/cm of all fractions with IDs presented in Var_names_dat_LUC.csv. Fractions are indicated by coarse and fine in the column Fraction. All .csv use ',' as separator. Additionl infrmation can be requested or is given in the published article.

Dieser Datensatz enthaelt die Daten, die in der Geoderma Veroeffentlichung „Separating fast from slow cycling soil organic carbon - A multi-method comparison on land use change sites' von Schiedung et al. (2025) veroeffentlicht sind. Es sind alle publizierten Daten veroeffentlicht in drei .csv Dateien und eine Beschreibung der Parameter in Var_naes_dat_LUC.csv. Eine der Dateien enthaelt alle veroeffentlichten Daten und die zwei weiteren enthalten die Spektren jeder Probe im MIR Bereich.

citation.title: Carbon sequestration potential in hedgerow soils: Results from 23 sites in Germany

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Dataset to the manuscript: Drexler, S. & Don, A. (2024). Carbon sequestration potential in hedgerow soils: Results from 23 sites in Germany. Geoderma. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.geoderma.2024.116878 Drexler_Don_2024_Data: contains the lab data for all samples Drexler_Don_2024_SOC_Stock_Per_Core: contains the calculated SOC stocks per soil core

Datensatz zum Manuskript: Drexler, S. & Don, A. (2024). Carbon sequestration potential in hedgerow soils: Results from 23 sites in Germany. In der Studie wurde das Potential zur Steigerung des Bodenkohlenstoffvorrats durch die Neuanlage von Hecken auf Ackerstandorten untersucht. Werden Hecken neu angelegt, kann zusaetzlich CO2 in der aufwachsenden Biomasse und im Boden langfristig gebunden werden. Hecken haben damit grosses Potential zum Klimaschutz beizutragen. An 23 Standorten in Deutschland wurden die Bodenkohlenstoffvorraete in einem gepaarten Beporbungsansatz (Hecke und Acker) untersucht. Der Datensatz enthaelt die Labordaten aller Einzelproben der Studie (Drexler_Don_2024_Data) sowie die berechneten Bodenkohlenstoffvorraete der Bohrkerne (Drexler_Don_2024_SOC_Stock_Per_Core).

citation.title: Photos of marine litter in the shallow seafloor of the southernmost North and Baltic seas during the Walther Herwig III cruise WH462 in 2022

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Der Datensatz besteht aus einer Reihe von Fotos von Meeresmuell am Meeresboden und den entsprechenden Koordinaten. Die Fotos wurden in der suedlichsten Nord- und Ostsee zwischen dem 30.11.2022 und dem 12.12.2022 waehrend der Walther Herwig III 462-Forschungsreise aufgenommen (Datum Beginn: 29.11.2022 - Datum Ende: 14.12.2022, Hafenbeginn: Bremerhaven - Hafenende: Bremerhaven). Das verwendete Videosystem besteht aus einer GoPro HERO 9 black in einem Aluminiumgehaeuse, das vorne am Schlitten montiert ist, und zwei Scheinwerfern mit insgesamt 7200 Lumen. Drei in einem gleichseitigen Dreieck montierte Laserpointer (Abstand des Laserschwerpunkts 25,5 cm) dienten als Groessenreferenz fuer die Videobeobachtung. Die Fotos wurden im Rahmen einer Studie aufgenommen, um die Menge des Meeresmuells im Meeresboden visuell zu quantifizieren und diesen Wert mit Grundschleppnetzdaten zu vergleichen.

The dataset is a set of photos of marine litter at the seafloor and corresponding coordinates. The photos were taken in the southernmost North and Baltic seas, between 30.11.2022 and 12.12.2022 during the Walther Herwig III 462 research cruise (Date begin: 29.11.2022 - Date end: 14.12.2022, harbor begin: Bremerhaven - harbor end: Bremerhaven). The video system used consists of a GoPro HERO 9 black in an aluminium case mounted in the front of the sledge and two lights with a total of 7200 lumen. Three laser pointers mounted in an equilateral triangle (laser center point distance 25.5 cm) provided the size reference for the video observation. The photos were taken as part of a study to visually quantify the amount of marine litter in the seafloor and compare this value with bottom trawl data.

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: Water eDNA metabarcoding: mifish primer dataset

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: In June 2019, the Thuenen Institute conducted the WH429 research cruise with the aim of assessing marine biodiversity through environmental DNA (eDNA) analysis. During the expedition, eDNA samples were collected from various marine locations and subsequently processed for metabarcoding using the MiFish primers, which target a specific region of the mitochondrial 12S rRNA gene in fish. The resulting eDNA sequences were generated on the Illumina MiSeq platform, producing high-quality fastq files. This dataset provides critical metadata, including sequencing reads, quality scores, which are essential for studying the spatial and temporal patterns of fish diversity. The comprehensive eDNA dataset serves as a valuable resource for ecological and conservation research, enabling the identification of fish species and the monitoring of marine ecosystems with high resolution and accuracy.

Im Juni 2019 fuehrte das Thuenen-Institut die Forschungsfahrt WH429 mit dem Ziel durch, die marine Biodiversitaet durch Umwelt-DNA-Analysen (eDNA) zu bewerten. Waehrend der Expedition wurden eDNA-Proben von verschiedenen marinen Standorten gesammelt und anschliessend fuer die Metabarcodierung mit den MiFish-Primer verarbeitet, die auf eine bestimmte Region des mitochondrialen 12S rRNA-Gens in Fischen abzielen. Die daraus resultierenden eDNA-Sequenzen wurden auf der Illumina MiSeq-Plattform generiert, wobei hochwertige fastq-Dateien erzeugt wurden. Dieser Datensatz enthaelt wichtige Metadaten, darunter Sequenzierungslesezeichen, Qualitaetsbewertungen und taxonomische Anmerkungen, die fuer die Untersuchung der raeumlichen und zeitlichen Muster der Fischvielfalt unerlaesslich sind. Der umfassende eDNA-Datensatz ist eine wertvolle Ressource fuer die Umwelt- und Naturschutzforschung und ermoeglicht die Identifizierung von Fischarten und die Ueberwachung von Meeresoekosystemen.

citation.title: Quecksilber in Fischen aus der Nord- und Ostsee (2017)

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Quecksilber gehoert zu den giftigsten Elementen auf unserem Planeten und ist weltweit verbreitet. Die Gehalte von Quecksilber in Meeresfisch werden im Rahmen des Umwelt-Monitorings des Thuenen-Instituts fuer Fischereioekologie regelmaessig ueberwacht, u.a. um regionale und zeitliche Unterschiede in der Kontamination zu erfassen. Die Ergebnisse fliessen in nationale und europaeische Umweltbewertungen ein. Die Daten sind Teil des Monitorings im Thuenen-Institut fuer Fischereioekologie und sind als solche ueber die ICES-Datenbank Dome oeffentlich zugaenglich. Erlaeuterungen zu den ICES Codes in der angehaengten Datei findet man hier: https://www.ices.dk/data/vocabularies/Pages/default.aspx

citation.title: Dataset for 'Towards an ecosystem capacity to stabilise organic carbon in soils'

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: This dataset includes the data that was used in the Global Change Biology publication 'Towards an ecosystem capacity to stabilise organic carbon in soils' by Poeplau et al.. It contains two xlsx files, with dataset_full.xlsx including all sites with soil properties that were used in the first part of the manuscript. It is a combined dataset from several open source datasets with a total of 1396 individual sites. The file modelled_converged.xlsx includes the RothC model results of a total of 587 sites, for which modelling was possible and a convergence of measured and modelled data was reached. Both files include two sheets, one with a short explanation of the variable names and one data sheet.

Dieser Datensatz enthaelt die Daten, die in der Global Change Biology Veroeffentlichung 'Towards an ecosystem capacity to stabilise organic carbon in soils' von Poeplau et al. verwendet wurden. Er enthaelt zwei xlsx-Dateien, wobei dataset_full.xlsx alle Standorte mit Bodeneigenschaften enthaelt, die im ersten Teil des Manuskripts verwendet wurden. Es handelt sich um einen kombinierten Datensatz aus mehreren Open-Source-Datensaetzen mit insgesamt 1396 Einzelstandorten. Die Datei modelled_converged.xlsx enthaelt die RothC-Modellergebnisse von insgesamt 587 Standorten, fuer die eine Modellierung moeglich war und eine Konvergenz von gemessenen und modellierten Daten erreicht wurde. Beide Dateien enthalten zwei Blaetter, eines mit einer kurzen Erlaeuterung der Variablennamen und ein Datenblatt.

citation.title: Dataset for the manuscript 'Land use and soil property effects on aggregate stability assessed by three different slaking methods'

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: This dataset was used in the research article 'Land use and soil property effects on aggregate stability assessed by three different slaking methods' as published in European Journal of Soil Science by Poeplau et al.. It contains six individual data files (xlsx). The main dataset, including aggregate stability data and soil properties of 100 samples, is stored in data_AS.xlsx. The coordinates (lat/long) of the 50 investigated points are stored in coordinates.xlsx, while available management information of the 50 sampled croplands are stored in management.xlsx. One part of the manuscript was a reporducibility test of the three used methods. Data of this test are stored in repro_test.xlsx. In addition, all samples were also analysed with a DRIFT spectrometer. The full, processed spectral data is stored in dat_spc.xlsx, while data of the derived spectral indices is stored in dat_RPA.xlsx.

citation.title: Agricultural land use (raster) : National-scale crop type maps for Germany from combined time series of Sentinel-1, Sentinel-2 and Landsat data (2024)

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: The dataset contains a map of the main classes of agricultural land use (dominant crop types and other land use types) in Germany for the year 2024. It complements a series of maps that are produced annually at the Thuenen Institute beginning with the year 2017 on the basis of satellite data. The maps cover the entire open landscape, i.e., the agriculturally used area (UAA) and e.g., uncultivated areas. The data and methods used to create this map differ from those used in previous versions. The map was derived from a time series of Sentinel-2 and Landsat 8/9 images. Map production is based on the methods described in Pham et al. (2024). All optical satellite data were managed, pre-processed and structured in an analysis-ready data (ARD) cube using the open-source software FORCE - Framework for Operational Radiometric Correction for Environmental monitoring (Frantz, D., 2019), in which SAR and environmental data were integrated. The map extent covers all areas in Germany that are defined as agricultural land, grassland, small woody features, heathland, peatland or unvegetated areas according to ATKIS Basis-DLM (Geobasisdaten: © GeoBasis-DE / BKG, 2020). Version v201: Post-processing of the maps included a sieve filter as well as a ruleset for the reduction of non-plausible areas using the Basis-DLM and the digital terrain model of Germany (Geobasisdaten: © GeoBasis-DE / BKG, 2015). Version v202: Additional post-processing was performed to detect and mask additional non-plausible areas that were not adequately covered by the first post-processing (e.g., areas with sparse vegetation, montane forests) based on the „Oekosystematlas Deutschland' (© Statistisches Bundesamt, Deutschland, 2024). As a consequence, the current version includes a new class 'Small woody features on other land'. Furthermore, the class 'permanent grassland' was refinded. Each pixel that was classified as 'cultivated grassland' in at least five years (between 2017 and 2022) was translated to 'permanent grassland' in the annual maps. The maps are available as cloud optimized GeoTiffs, which makes downloading the full dataset optional. All data can directly be accessed in QGIS, R, Python or any supported software of your choice using the URL that will be provided on request. By doing so the entire map area or only the regions of interest can be accessed. QGIS legend files for data visualization can be downloaded separately. Class-specific accuracies for each year are proveded in the respective tables. We provide this dataset 'as is' without any warranty regarding the accuracy or completeness and exclude all liability. References: Pham, V.-D., Tetteh, G., Thiel, F., Erasmi, S., Schwieder, M., Frantz, D., & van der Linden, S. (2024). Temporally transferable crop mapping with temporal encoding and deep learning augmentations. International Journal of Applied Earth Observation and Geoinformation, 129, 103867. BKG, Bundesamt fuer Kartographie und Geodaesie (2015). Digitales Gelaendemodell Gitterweite 10 m. DGM10. https://sg.geodatenzentrum.de/web_public/gdz/dokumentation/deu/dgm10.pdf (last accessed: 28. April 2022). BKG, Bundesamt fuer Kartographie und Geodaesie (2020). Digitales Basis-Landschaftsmodell. https://sg.geodatenzentrum.de/web_public/gdz/dokumentation/deu/basis-dlm.pdf (last accessed: 28. April 2022). Frantz, D. (2019). FORCE--Landsat + Sentinel-2 Analysis Ready Data and Beyond. Remote Sensing, 11, 1124. Statistisches Bundesamt, Deutschland (2024). Oekosystematlas Deutschland https://oekosystematlas-ugr.destatis.de/ (last accessed: 08.02.2024). ______________________________________________________________________ National-scale crop type maps for Germany from combined time series of Sentinel-1, Sentinel-2 and Landsat data (2024) © 2025 by Tetteh, Gideon Okpoti; Schwieder, Marcel; Blickensdoerfer, Lukas; Gocht, Alexander; Erasmi, Stefan; licensed under CC BY 4.0. citation.title: Climate-driven changes in fish habitat in the North and Baltic Seas: historical decadal changes and future projections

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: The data contain habitat suitability (given in %) and biomass (given in tons) of commercial fish species in the North Sea and Baltic Sea. For the North Sea, habitat suitability is shown for the 1970s and as a change in response to climate change across decades from 1970 to 2050. For the Baltic Sea, habitat suitability is shown for the 1990s and as a change in response to climate change across decades from 1990 to 2050. Biomass distribution in 2050 was mapped according to habitat suitability as redistribution of three scenarios of total biomass (high, medium and low). Those scenarios were retrieved based ICES Stock assessment time-series. Data can be viewed using the web-map available at Thuenen Atlas.

citation.title: OtolithenKI versions (portable)

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: This is the portable version of the AI-based platform/application from Thuenen Institute of Sea Fisheries that allows the use of Mask R-CNN and U-Net to perform automated fish age reading. In addition, the use of advanced concepts such as tranfer learning, ensemble learning and continual learning is also made accessible. Lastly, a set of useful annotation tools is also included such as simplified brush toolkit (based from VIA) along with the possibility of using existing AI models to assist in the ground-truth labeling process.

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: Per- und Polyfluoralkylchemikalien (PFAS) in Fischen aus der Nord- und Ostsee (2021)

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Per- und Polyfluoralkylchemikalien (PFAS) sind industriell hergestellte persistente fluorierte organische Substanzen, die z.B. zur Ausruestung von Textilien und zur Oberflaechenbehandlung verwendet werden. Sie sind weltweit verbreitet und wurden z.B. in Eisbaeren gefunden. Einige PFAS stehen im Verdacht krebserregend zu sein. Die hoechsten PAFS-Belastungen in Fischen findet man im Suesswasser. Gehalte von PFAS in Meeresfisch sind oft in der Naehe der analytischen Nachweisgrenze. Die Gehalte werden im Rahmen des Umwelt-Monitorings des Thuenen-Instituts fuer Fischereioekologie regelmaessig ueberwacht, um die Hoehe der Belastung zu erfassen und zu bewerten sowie regionale und zeitliche Unterschiede in dieser Belastung festzustellen. Die Ergebnisse fliessen in nationale und europaeische Umweltbewertungen ein.

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: Jaehrliche Abfrage der Forstressorts der Bundeslaender zu stillgelegten Waldflaechen - 2020 - 2022

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Das Thuenen-Institut fuer Waldwirtschaft ist, im Auftrag des Statistischen Bundesamts, zustaendig fuer die Erstellung der Waldgesamtrechnung (WGR) als Teil der Umweltoekonomischen Gesamtrechnung der Bundesrepublik Deutschland und als Teil der EU-weiten European Forest Accounts. In der WGR werden in 10 Tabellen die Ressource Wald und ihr Produkt Holz von der Flaeche ueber den physischen Vorrat, dessen Wert und Nutzungen, bis hin zur Verarbeitung des Holzes in der Holzindustrie, dargestellt. Tabelle A 1a Area of wooded land in 1000 ha der WGR beinhaltet die physische Waldflaechenbilanz. Dort wird die gesamte deutsche Waldflaeche im jeweiligen Berichtsjahr, sowie die landwirtschaftliche Flaeche, die fuer die Produktion von Holz eingesetzt, abgebildet. Die Flaeche wird hierbei unterteilt nach 1.) Flaechen, die fuer die Rohholzproduktion zur Verfuegung stehen (FAWS), 2.) Flaechen, die fuer die Rohholzproduktion nicht zur Verfuegung stehen (FNAWS), 3.) sonstige Waldflaechen (in Deutschland nicht relevant) und 4.) sonstige bestockte Flaechen die fuer die Rohholzproduktion zur Verfuegung stehen (Code 3, hierunter fallen z.B. Agroforstflaechen und Kurzumtriebsplantagen). Die FNAWS-Flaeche besteht aus Waldflaechen auf denen z.B. wegen rechtlicher Beschraenkungen oder durch politische Vorgaben eine Rohholzproduktion kaum oder gar nicht moeglich ist (z.B. Stilllegungsflaechen) und aus Waldflaechen, auf denen die Wuchsleistung oder die Holzqualitaet so gering oder die Holzernte- und Holzbringungskosten so hoch sind, dass eine Rohholzproduktion kaum moeglich ist. Fuer die Berechnung der jaehrlichen Aenderungen der FNAWS-Waldflaeche in Tabelle A1a werden in den fuer Forstwirtschaft zustaendigen Ministerien der Bundeslaender jaehrlich Daten zu den Waldflaechen erhoben, auf denen im jeweiligen WGR-Berichtsjahr dauerhaft die forstliche Nutzung eingestellt wurde (Stilllegungsflaechen). Als Stilllegungsflaechen werden alle, aufgrund von gesetzlichen Schutzgebietsausweisungen dauerhaft aus der forstlichen Nutzung genommenen Waldflaechen verstanden (hierunter fallen z.B. Kernzonen von Nationalparks oder Bannwaelder).

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: Data from: Autumn and winter plankton composition and size structure in the North Sea

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Plankton dynamics in temperate ecosystems have been mainly studied during productive seasons, with comparatively less research conducted during the winter, particularly on microplankton. Implementing plankton sampling during a regular fishery cruise, we investigated the North Sea micro- and mesozooplankton community composition, abundance and size structure (55-2000 µm) during autumn (Buchan/Banks area) and winter (Downs area) between 2013 and 2019. Samples were analyzed using image-based techniques. Community diversity (broad taxa) was relatively similar across years in both areas, with diatoms and tripos taxa sets dominating the microplankton community and gastropods and copepods the mesozooplankton one. The average micro- to mesoozooplankton ratio (in abundance) was 90:1 for Buchan/Banks, resulting in average Normalized Abundance Size Spectra (NASS) slopes of -1.45 ±0.18 SD. For Downs, the micro- to mesoozooplankton ratio was 235:1 and steeper NASS slopes of -1.67 ±0.20 SD due to a lower contribution of large organisms. Interannual changes in the planktonic community for each area and their potential environmental drivers were examined using a redundancy analysis (including taxonomy and size) and a correlation analysis using NASS slopes (size only). Both approaches highlighted the importance of water mass properties (e.g. salinity, temperature, turbidity) in shaping plankton dynamics, although the amount of explained variance differed between approaches (11 versus 46%). Our results contribute to a better understanding of standing stocks of plankton and their environmental drivers. Specifically, novel insights were gained into microplankton dynamics, which play an important role in supporting the growth and survival of winter-spawned fish larvae in the North Sea.

citation.title: Jaehrliche Abfrage der Forstressorts der Bundeslaender zu stillgelegten Waldflaechen - 2022 - 2024

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Das Thuenen-Institut fuer Waldwirtschaft ist, im Auftrag des Statistischen Bundesamts, zustaendig fuer die Erstellung der Waldgesamtrechnung (WGR) als Teil der Umweltoekonomischen Gesamtrechnung der Bundesrepublik Deutschland und als Teil der EU-weiten European Forest Accounts. In der WGR werden in 10 Tabellen die Ressource Wald und ihr Produkt Holz von der Flaeche ueber den physischen Vorrat, dessen Wert und Nutzungen, bis hin zur Verarbeitung des Holzes in der Holzindustrie, dargestellt. Tabelle A 1a Area of wooded land in 1000 ha der WGR beinhaltet die physische Waldflaechenbilanz. Dort wird die gesamte deutsche Waldflaeche im jeweiligen Berichtsjahr, sowie die landwirtschaftliche Flaeche, die fuer die Produktion von Holz eingesetzt, abgebildet. Die Flaeche wird hierbei unterteilt nach 1.) Flaechen, die fuer die Rohholzproduktion zur Verfuegung stehen (FAWS), 2.) Flaechen, die fuer die Rohholzproduktion nicht zur Verfuegung stehen (FNAWS), 3.) sonstige Waldflaechen (in Deutschland nicht relevant) und 4.) sonstige bestockte Flaechen die fuer die Rohholzproduktion zur Verfuegung stehen (Code 3, hierunter fallen z.B. Agroforstflaechen und Kurzumtriebsplantagen). Die FNAWS-Flaeche besteht aus Waldflaechen auf denen z.B. wegen rechtlicher Beschraenkungen oder durch politische Vorgaben eine Rohholzproduktion kaum oder gar nicht moeglich ist (z.B. Stilllegungsflaechen) und aus Waldflaechen, auf denen die Wuchsleistung oder die Holzqualitaet so gering oder die Holzernte- und Holzbringungskosten so hoch sind, dass eine Rohholzproduktion kaum moeglich ist. Fuer die Berechnung der jaehrlichen Aenderungen der FNAWS-Waldflaeche in Tabelle A1a werden in den fuer Forstwirtschaft zustaendigen Ministerien der Bundeslaender jaehrlich Daten zu den Waldflaechen erhoben, auf denen im jeweiligen WGR-Berichtsjahr dauerhaft die forstliche Nutzung eingestellt wurde (Stilllegungsflaechen). Als Stilllegungsflaechen werden alle, aufgrund von gesetzlichen Schutzgebietsausweisungen dauerhaft aus der forstlichen Nutzung genommenen Waldflaechen verstanden (hierunter fallen z.B. Kernzonen von Nationalparks oder Bannwaelder).

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: Non-targeted analysis of lipophilic and hydrophilic metabolites to distinguish between fresh and frozen-thawed fish of certain fish species using comprehensive 1H NMR spectroscopy and multivariate data analysis

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: This dataset is the basis for a publication regarding the differentiation of fresh and frozen-thawed fish via nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy (https://doi.org/10.1007/s00217-025-04978-6). Food fraud along the production chain is a well-known issue that requires an effective authenticity control. For the differentiation of fresh and frozen-thawed fish, 1H nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) spectroscopy based methods in combination with multivariate data analysis have proven to be suitable in principle. Here, from a total of 317 samples (cod, rainbow trout, mackerel; fresh and frozen-thawed), the lipid and polar fractions of the fish flesh were analyzed, and classification models based on a principal components analysis with linear discriminant analysis (PCA-LDA) including cross-validation were generated. Additionally, data fusions were carried out. The obtained average accuracies of > 90% (94.0% based on the lipid fraction, 92.8% based on the polar fraction) and > 95% (95.6% based on a low-level data fusion, 95.5% based on a mid-level data fusion) demonstrated a promising differentiation. Further examinations confirmed that the non-targeted analysis appears to be mandatory as no marker substances were indicated in the loadings plots of the models. To evaluate whether the generated classification models are suitable to be used in a broader manner, they were applied to 13 fresh and 13 frozen-thawed samples from twelve other common edible fish species in a preliminary study. The classification model based on the low-level data fusion gave the best results (84.6% of all 26 samples correctly predicted). Thus, although these models are very suitable for analyzing cod, rainbow trout, or mackerel for a classification as fresh or frozen-thawed, they cannot generally be applied to samples of other fish species. Datasets containing NMR spectra of samples from the classification models and of samples from other fish species are provided, as well as relevant metadata.

citation.title: Blei in Fischen aus der Nord- und Ostsee (2023)

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Blei ist ein giftiges Schwermetall und weltweit verbreitet. Die Gehalte von Blei in Meeresfisch werden im Rahmen des Umwelt-Monitorings des Thuenen-Instituts fuer Fischereioekologie regelmaessig ueberwacht, u.a. um regionale und zeitliche Unterschiede in der Kontamination zu erfassen. Die Ergebnisse fliessen in nationale und europaeische Umweltbewertungen ein. Die Daten sind Teil des Monitorings im Thuenen-Institut fuer Fischereioekologie und sind als solche ueber die ICES-Datenbank Dome oeffentlich zugaenglich. Erlaeuterungen zu den ICES Codes in der angehaengten Datei findet man hier: https://www.ices.dk/data/vocabularies/Pages/default.aspx

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: Contamination of dab (Limanda limanda) with explosive chemicals leaking from marine dumped munition

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Conventional munition dumped into the North Sea and the Baltic Sea close to the German coastline is corroding. A major concern is that biota, including fish, take up toxic explosives leaking into marine environments. With the present study, we investigated bile fluids of fish living in close proximity to munition dumping sites for the explosives 2,4,6-trinitrotoluene (TNT), its metabolites 2-amino-4,6-dinitrolouene and 4-amino-2,6-dinitrolouene as well as octahydro-1,3,5,7-tetranitro-1,3,5,7-tetrazocine (HMX) using HPLC-MS/MS (high performance liquid chromatography with mass selective detection) as device. The flat fish species common dab (Limanda limanda) was used as a model, since it lives in the vicinity of dumping sites and exhibits minor migratory activity.

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: OtolithenKI versions (portable)

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: This is the portable version of the AI-based platform/application from Thuenen Institute of Sea Fisheries that allows the use of Mask R-CNN and U-Net to perform automated fish age reading. In addition, the use of advanced concepts such as tranfer learning, ensemble learning and continual learning is also made accessible. Lastly, a set of useful annotation tools is also included such as simplified brush toolkit (based from VIA) along with the possibility of using existing AI models to assist in the ground-truth labeling process.

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: Mesopelagic fishes of the Benguela upwelling system, cruise RV Meteor 153, 2019, and cruise RV Sonne 285, 2021

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: The Benguela upwelling system is one of the most productive marine ecosystems in the world; however, little is known about the community structure of mesopelagic fishes in its northern (nBUS) and southern (sBUS) subsystems. We analyzed around 1900 specimens from 13 stations in 2019, austral summer, in the nBUS and 11 stations in the sBUS during the austral summer and found 88 species and 24 families of mesopelagic fishes. Seven distinct assemblages characterized by water mass, oxygen concentration in the surface layer, and chlorophyll concentrations between 50 and 100 m were identified. In 2021 in austral winter, 15 stations were analyzed, of which 7 belonged to sBUS and 8 to nBUS.

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: Dataset: Identifying environmental factors affecting the microbial community composition on outdoor structural timber

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: 46 rotten timber parts were sampled in the City of Hamburg, Germany. From 50mg of wood dry weight we extracted DNA, PCR-amplified the fungal ITS2 region and partial bacterial 16S genes and investigated the microbial community composition through amplicon sequencing. Here we present the sequencing depth per sample, ASV tables and taxonomy tables for fungi and bacteria, which were generated with QIIME2. Methodology: Next Generation Sequencing

46 verrottete Holzteile wurden in der Stadt Hamburg, Deutschland, beprobt. Wir extrahierten die DANN aus 50mg getrocknetem Holz, amplifizierten die pilzliche ITS2-Region und partielle bakterielle 16S-Gene mittels PCR und untersuchten die Zusammensetzung der mikrobiellen Gemeinschaft durch Amplikon-Sequenzierung. Hier praesentieren wir die unbearbeiteten Sequenzdaten, die mit einem Illumina MiSeq (paired end, 2x 300bp) generiert wurden. Methode: Next Generation Sequencing

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: Supporting data for the manuscript 'Birch (Betula pubescens Ehrh.) encroachment alters contribution of plant functional groups to ecosystem carbon cycling in a rewetted bog'

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Rewetted bogs with high water levels (WL) and mire-specific vegetation are crucial carbon (C) sinks, but their function might be threatened by tree encroachment, a phenomenon widespread in the northern hemisphere that often coincides with low WL. This might impact C cycling both at the ecosystem and microform scale in multiple ways, but so far, data is lacking. We established two sites in the same former peat extraction area, one showing permanently high WL and mire-specific vegetation (Open site, OS), while the other one has more fluctuating WL and a dense birch (Betula pubescens Ehrh.) population (Tree site, TS). We measured the carbon dioxide (CO2) exchange at ecosystem (eddy covariance) and plot scale (chamber measurements) for one year to clarify the differences between the sites and the impact of birch encroachment on the contribution of the different bog-specific microforms to the ecosystem's CO2 balance. Overall, the OS had a CO2 balance of -262.4 ± 7.8 g CO2-C m-2 yr-1 indicating CO2 uptake, while the TS was close to neutral (-28 ± 5.1 g CO2-C m-2 yr-1). The smaller uptake at the TS was caused by higher (151%) ecosystem respiration, while gross primary production was only 15% difference. However, the microform contributions to C uptake strongly differed: At the OS, both hummocks and hollows showed net uptake, while at the TS, most C (52%) was assimilated by the birches and the understory was a net CO2 source. This indicates a loss of peat C from the TS, while the successfully rewetted site was accumulating new peat. Accounting for plot-scale CH4 fluxes, both sites were a weak source of greenhouse gases, but a distinctly stronger C sink occurred at the OS. Our data shows the possibility to increase C removal from the atmosphere by full rewetting and the establishment of mire-specific vegetation.

citation.title: Results of an internal survey on the publication of code at the JKI

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: This dataset presents the anonymized results of a comprehensive online survey (https://ilias.julius-kuehn.de/ilias.php?baseClass=ilobjsurveygui&cmd=infoScreen&ref_id=1703) conducted among scientific and technical staff, doctoral students, and visiting scientists at the Julius Kuehn Institute (JKI) in July-August 2025. The survey investigated practices, barriers, needs, and motivations concerning code publication at JKI. Topics include code usage and sharing, documentation standards, knowledge of persistent identifiers, hosting preferences, and institutional requirements. Both quantitative questions (single- and multiple-choice, Likert scales) and qualitative questions (free text) are included. The dataset offers evidence to inform JKI's policy development and support services for open science and research software publication. Coverage & Methodology Spatial Coverage: Julius Kuehn Institute (JKI), Germany Temporal Coverage: Survey period: July 15 - August 4, 2025 Population: JKI scientific, technical, and doctoral staff Sample Size: 76-105 respondents (variable by question) from ~600 invited participants, completely filled out by an average of approximately 70% of participants. Data Collection: Online, anonymized survey with mixed methods (quantitative and qualitative questions) Languages: German and English (questions generally bilingual, responses in both languages) Topics & Structure Sections: Institute location, department, career level, programming language use, code publication and reuse experience, code documentation, hosting platforms, persistent identifiers, user needs and experiences (Likert scale), hosting preferences, required support services, and free text responses for obstacles, incentives, and suggestions Sheets/Variables: Each topic covered in a separate worksheet, with aggregated quantitative data (counts, most frequent choices, means/medians) and selected anonymized free text answers Data Types: Single-choice, multiple-choice, and matrix questions; open-ended free text items Key Variables/Fields Location, Institute/Department, Career Level, Programming Languages Code publication and reuse practices Code documentation methods Software hosting platforms Persistent identifier awareness User needs and experiences regarding legal support, DOI assignment, training, resource availability, data protection, and institutional incentives Obstacles to code publication Preferred forms of recognition and further suggestions Format XLSX file: Each worksheet contains summarized survey data for a thematic block, including frequencies, proportions, and, where applicable, raw or categorized free text responses

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: Polychlorierte Biphenyle (PCB) in Fischen aus der Nord- und Ostsee (2021)

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Polychlorierte Biphenyle (PCB) sind industriell hergestellte persistente chlorierte organische Substanzen, die z.B. in Kondensatoren, Transformatoren oder in Hydraulikoel eingesetzt wurden. Ihr Einsatz ist seit 2001 weltweit verboten. Einige PCB sind krebserregend und habe aufgrund ihrer aehnlichen Struktur eine vergleichbare Wirkung wie Dioxin. Die hoechsten PCB-Belastungen findet man in Organismen am Ende der Nahrungskette wie Raubfischen oder marinen Saeugern. Gemessen werden die sechs Indikator-PCBs 28, 52, 101, 138, 153, 180 und das dioxinaehnliche PCB-Kongener 118. Die Gehalte werden im Rahmen des Umwelt-Monitorings des Thuenen-Instituts fuer Fischereioekologie regelmaessig ueberwacht, um die Hoehe der Belastung zu erfassen und zu bewerten sowie regionale und zeitliche Unterschiede in dieser Belastung festzustellen. Die Ergebnisse fliessen in nationale und europaeische Umweltbewertungen ein.

subject: Agricultural Sciences

citation.title: How Does Regionality Influence Meaning Structures Concerning Peatland Rewetting in Germany? A Structural Topic Modeling (STM) Approach to Understanding the Discourse on a large-scale Climate Protection Measure

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: The data and code published here relate to a study that presents an analysis of the recent German discourse on peatland rewetting. The study is based on a data corpus of 1,957 newspaper articles published between 2019 and July 2023, mainly in peatland-rich regions of Germany. We focus our investigation on the influence of regionality on the public sensemaking about peatland rewetting. Due to the large scope of the analysis, we used Structural Topic Modeling (STM) as a technique to identify discursive features and meaning structures. The data provided here are supplementary material to the analysis. We provide a commented code that makes the data preprocessing and analysis steps transparent. Furthermore, we publish datasets containing the metadata of the newspaper articles and the probabilities to which they are assigned for each of the 35 calculated topics used for the interpretation.

citation.title: PAH-Metaboliten in Fischen aus der Nord- und Ostsee (2019)

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Polyaromatische Kohlenwasserstoffe (PAH) sind Bestandteil fossiler Energietraeger und haben natuerliche und anthropogene Quellen. Man findet sie in der Umwelt zum Beispiel in der Naehe von Haefen oder Schifffahrtsrouten. Zur Gruppe der PAH gehoeren auch krebserregende Substanzen. Fische metabolisieren PAH sehr schnell, so dass PAH selbst in Fischen kaum nachweisbar sind, wohl aber ihre Metaboliten in der Galle des Fisches. Die Gehalte von PAK-Metaboliten in Meeresfisch werden im Rahmen des Umwelt-Monitorings des Thuenen-Instituts fuer Fischereioekologie regelmaessig ueberwacht, um die Hoehe der PAK-Belastung indirekt zu erfassen und zu bewerten sowie regionale und zeitliche Unterschiede in dieser Belastung festzustellen. Die Ergebnisse fliessen in nationale und europaeische Umweltbewertungen ein. Die Daten sind Teil des Monitorings im Thuenen-Institut fuer Fischereioekologie und sind als solche ueber die ICES-Datenbank Dome oeffentlich zugaenglich. citation.title: Kosten von Vernaessungsmassnahmen organischer Boeden in Mecklenburg-Vorpommern und Brandenburg (Datensatz)

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Der Datensatz erfasst die Kosten von Vernaessungsprojekten organischer Boeden in Brandenburg und Mecklenburg-Vorpommern. Die Kosten sind in die Hauptkategorien Administration, bauliche Umsetzung und jaehrlich Kosten untergliedert. Innerhalb dieser Kategorien erfolgt eine weitere Differenzierung nach einzelnen Kostenkomponenten. Die Differenzierung ist notwendig, da die Ausgangssituation der Flaechen und die Nachnutzung Kosten in verschiedener Hoehe verursachen koennen. Weiterhin ist auch nicht jede einzelne Komponente in jedem Projekt notwendig. Zur Abbildung moeglicher Skaleneffekte sind die Kosten fuer drei Groessenklassen ausgewiesen. Die Kosten werden ausserdem in Form von Spannen dargestellt; einen Minimalwert, den Durchschnittswert sowie einen Maximalwert.
